0.title: Consumer forum directs Gurugram civic body to ban 11 pet dog breeds
0.article_body: A consumer disputes redressal forum has issued a directive to Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) to ban 11 pet dog breeds with immediate effect. The forum did so while ordering the MCG to give an interim compensation of ₹2 lakh to a woman who was attacked by a dog in August. The banned breeds include Rottweiler, Bandog, Dogo Argentino, etc.

1.title: BBMP extends timings of public parks in Bengaluru amid public demand
1.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday extended timings of all parks across the city, following protests by citizens. According to BBMP's order, parks will now remain open from 5 am to 8 pm every day, except between 10 am to 1.30 pm due to maintenance work. Earlier, parks were open between 6 am-10 am and 4 pm-7 pm.

2.title: Mumbai woman accuses mother of cheating during online LLB exams
2.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, a doctor based in Mumbai, has filed a complaint against her mother for allegedly cheating during LLB exams that were conducted online during lockdown in 2020. She alleged that her mother asked a man to take the exams on her behalf while keeping the camera off. She also accused her mother of having extramarital affairs.

3.title: Musk shares pic with 2 men who faked being fired from Twitter after his takeover
3.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted a picture of him posing with men apparently named Rahul Ligma and Daniel Johnson and wrote, "Welcoming back Ligma & Johnson!" He added, "Important to admit when I'm wrong and firing them was truly one of my biggest mistakes." Ligma and Johnson had pretended to be laid-off Twitter employees giving media interviews after Musk's acquisition.

4.title: PCB evicts 500 hawkers from roads; 50 kiosks, 100 handcarts seized
4.article_body: Following criticism, Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) carried out a massive crackdown against unauthorised structures built by hawkers on roads and evicted 500 of them from MG road, East street and Centre street, among others. It also seized 50 kiosks and 100 handcarts. "We'll continue strong action against all unauthorised and illegal structures built by the hawkers," the PCB CEO said.

5.title: Poland blast may not be from Russian missile: US President Biden at emergency meet
5.article_body: The US and its NATO allies are investigating the blast that killed two in Poland, but early information suggests it may not have been caused by Russian missile, US President Joe Biden said. Global leaders gathered for the G20 meeting in Bali held an emergency meeting after explosions in Poland that Ukraine and Poland said were caused by Russian-made missiles.

6.title: Nominees for 2023 Grammy Awards announced, Beyoncé gets 9 nominations
6.article_body: The nominees for the 2023 Grammy Awards have been announced, with Beyoncé bagging most nominations (nine). She is followed by Kendrick Lamar (eight). Meanwhile, Adele and Brandi Carlile have bagged seven nominations each. The 2023 Grammy Awards will be the first time Beyoncé and Adele will go head-to-head for Record, Album, and Song of the Year since 2017.

7.title: Musk admits to firing staff critical of him, says 'I apologise for firing these geniuses'
7.article_body: Elon Musk admitted on Twitter that he fired employees who were critical of him on internal Slack channels. Replying to a tweet, Musk wrote, "I would like to apologise for firing these geniuses. Their immense talent will no doubt be of great use elsewhere." As per reports, Musk fired "dozens" of employees after they criticised him on Slack channels.

8.title: Donald Trump announces he will run for US president in 2024
8.article_body: Donald Trump has announced that he will run for the US president in 2024. "In order to make America great and glorious again, I tonight am announcing my candidacy for president of the United States," Trump said. "Two years ago, when I left office, the United States stood ready for its golden age," he further said.

9.title: Poland calls emergency meeting after 2 killed near Ukrainian border
9.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Tuesday called an emergency meeting with national security and defence ministers amid reports of stray Russian missiles landing on the territory of the NATO country near Ukraine, killing two people. European Council President Charles Michel said, "Shocked by the news...I am in contact with Polish authorities, members of the European Council and other allies."

10.title: Russian missiles cross into NATO member Poland, 2 killed
10.article_body: Russian missiles crossed into NATO member Poland, killing two people, a senior US intelligence official said on Tuesday. As per reports, the weapons hit a grain store in Przewodów, Lublin, near the border with Ukraine. Earlier on Tuesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated that Russia fired at least 85 missiles targeting Kyiv and other cities. "We'll survive everything," he stated.

11.title: Germany's gas storage levels hit 100% capacity earlier than expected
11.article_body: Germany's gas storage facilities have now reached 100% capacity, according to data published by the European gas storage association GIE on Tuesday. Berlin has been building its reserves since Russia significantly cut supplies amid tensions due to the war in Ukraine. Germany met its gas-saving targets ahead of schedule, having reached a 95% target set for November by mid-October.

12.title: Both Ukraine and Russia tortured prisoners of war: UN
12.article_body: Ukraine and Russia have tortured prisoners of war during the ongoing conflict between the nations, said the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights on Tuesday. The UN's monitoring team based its finding on over 100 interviews it conducted with prisoners of war on each side. The forms of torture included electric shocks, assault and forced nudity.

13.title: Man accused of putting beef in temple granted bail by Allahabad HC
13.article_body: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a man accused of putting beef inside a Shiva temple in Kannauj. The accused, Raheem, wasn't named in the FIR and his co-accused in the case had been granted bail by the high court in September. The case was lodged by a sub-inspector who was informed about the remains during a routine check.

14.title: Under-construction building collapses in Kenya's Nairobi
14.article_body: An under-construction, multi-storey building collapsed in the Kenyan capital Nairobi on Tuesday. Rescue operations started as construction workers are reportedly trapped under the debris. No official announcement has been made yet on possible casualties. The building was showing signs of weakness with visible cracks and local officials had asked labourers to leave, as per local media reports.

15.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz tests positive for COVID-19 for third time
15.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus, a day after he returned to his country from the UK. This is the third time Shehbaz has tested positive for the disease. After announcing Shehbaz's positive diagnosis, Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb appealed to the people to pray for the Prime Minister.

16.title: Alphabet has too many employees, needs to cut costs: Hedge Fund TCI
16.article_body: Activist investor TCI Fund Management wrote to Alphabet, asking it to cut costs and take aggressive action like increasing share buybacks. The hedge fund added that the company has too many employees, and the cost per employee is too high. TCI, an Alphabet investor, also asked Alphabet to disclose its operating profit margin targets and reduce losses in Other Bets.

17.title: 45-year-old man, his 2 daughters found hanging at home in UP's Gorakhpur
17.article_body: A 45-year-old man and his two minor daughters were found hanging at his residence in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Tuesday. The man's wife had died due to cancer about two years ago and he used to run a tailor's shop from his house. "We've initiated a probe and statements of...family members are being recorded," Gorakhpur SSP Gaurav Grover said.

18.title: Thank you PM Modi for global traditional health centre: WHO chief
18.article_body: Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday for collaborating with the world health body to build a global traditional health centre. The foundation stone for the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine was laid in Gujarat's Jamnagar in April this year.

19.title: Shelling kills 2, injures 3 in Russia's Belgorod region: Guv
19.article_body: The governor of Russia's Belgorod region on Tuesday said that two people had been killed and three wounded by shelling in a town near the border with Ukraine. Belgorod is one of several Russian regions where targets such as fuel and ammunition depots have been hit in the course of the Ukraine war. Russia blames Ukraine for the strikes.

20.title: Punjab Police conduct cordon-and-search operation against drugs
20.article_body: The Punjab Police conducted a special cordon-and-search operation to check anti-social elements and drug smuggling in the state. The operation, which was conducted from 11 am to 4 pm, used sniffer dogs and drones in drug and crime hotspots to ensure strict vigil. "Proper frisking of suspects and complete search of houses was done," Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said.

21.title: Speeding car hits over 12 labourers in MP's Ratlam; 4 killed, 8 injured
21.article_body: A speeding car ran over more than 12 labourers while they were working on a highway in Ratlam district of Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday, police said. While four labourers were killed, 13 others, including the car's five occupants, were injured. The injured were brought to the district hospital, said Ratlam Superintendent of Police Abhishek Tiwari.

22.title: Dharmendra Pradhan meets Finnish Education Minister in New Delhi
22.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan held a meeting with his Finnish counterpart, Petri Honkonen, in New Delhi on Tuesday. The ministers discussed topical issues of education in the challenging post-pandemic era, a press release by the Ministry of Education said. "The ministers also discussed...the path-breaking educational reforms currently underway in India," the communique added.

23.title: Hockey India announces 23-member men's team for tour of Australia
23.article_body: Hockey India has announced a 23-member men's team for the upcoming tour of Australia, beginning November 26 in Adelaide. Defender Harmanpreet Singh has been named the captain of the team, while Amit Rohidas has been picked as the vice-captain. The Indian team will play five matches against Australia as part of their preparation for next year's World Cup.

24.title: Oxygen cylinders weren't available in Delhi amid COVID-19: Kanhaiya
24.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar on Tuesday criticised the AAP and stated that oxygen cylinders were not available in Delhi during the second wave of COVID-19. Similarly, people were not getting oxygen cylinders in Ahmedabad civil hospital in BJP-ruled Gujarat, the ex-JNU student added. He further claimed that promises made during Anna Hazare's Andolan in 2011 were eventually shelved by AAP.

25.title: Completed 55% patchwork required to make Lucknow pothole free: Civic body
25.article_body: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) has completed around 55% of the patchwork required to make the city pothole free, while restoration work on potholed roads stands at only about 15%, officials claimed. "The tender process for this is underway and will be finalised on November 22," Mahesh Verma, Chief Engineer said. "The work will begin from November 23," Verma added.

26.title: Continental probes reported data theft after cyberattack
26.article_body: Tyre and automotive parts manufacturer Continental said it is investigating company data theft following a cyberattack after hackers reportedly put the information for sale. According to a report, the data, which included budget, investment, strategy and customer information, was put up for sale on the darknet after Continental refused to pay ransom. The data is on sale for $50 million.

27.title: Bhuvi to be next captain? Aakash on SRH releasing Williamson ahead of IPL 2023
27.article_body: After SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) released their captain Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023, Aakash Chopra took to Twitter and wrote, "Bhuvneshwar Kumar to be the next SRH captain?" Williamson scored 216 runs in 13 matches in IPL 2022. Under the captaincy of Williamson, the 2016 champions finished eighth out of 10 teams on the points table last season.

28.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried looking to raise funds: Report
28.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, is reportedly looking to raise fresh cash from investors. The company recently filed for bankruptcy after rival exchange Binance backed out from a deal to buy FTX stating that "the issues are beyond our control or ability to help". Bankman-Fried's entire $16 billion fortune has been wiped out.

29.title: I was called pansy, that wasn't my f***ing identity: Karan Johar
29.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who recently appeared as a guest on Tweak India, recalled being called "Pansy from Green Lawns High School" or "pansy from HR College". "That wasn't my f***ing identity...and that's what it had become. When I entered college from school I realised I had to wear 'manly clothes'," he added.

30.title: ICC names 10 best individual performances in T20 World Cup 2022
30.article_body: The ICC has named 10 best individual performances in T20 World Cup 2022. It includes Virat Kohli's 82*(53) against Pakistan. The list also features England fast bowler Sam Curran's 3/12 in the final against Pakistan. South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi's 4/29 against India and Pakistan's Shadab Khan's all-round performance against South Africa also feature on the list.

31.title: Apple Watch helps rescue boy who broke ankles during trek in Maha, Tim Cook reacts
31.article_body: A 17-year-old Maharashtra boy said his Apple Watch saved his life after he fell and broke both his ankles during a trek. Smit Metha said he was rescued as he called for help even without his phone, using his Apple Watch, after getting injured. Apple CEO Tim Cook emailed Smit, "Sounds like a terrible accident...wish you a full...speedy recovery."

32.title: Houses of 4 suspected ISIS sympathisers searched by police in TN
32.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police conducted searches for three hours at the houses of four people, who were allegedly suspected to be Islamic State (ISIS) sympathisers, in Chennai on Tuesday morning. Police seized cash worth ₹15 lakh and 150 mobile phones and other digital gadgets during the searches. Last week, the National Investigation Agency (NIA) raided 40 locations in the state.

33.title: Punjab govt to name schools after martyrs, freedom fighters
33.article_body: The Punjab government has announced that it will name state government schools after martyrs and freedom fighters. Village panchayats and school management committees have been asked to send resolutions for renaming schools to the state headquarters within the next month, state minister Harjot Singh Bains said. They also have to send biographical notes about martyrs and freedom fighters, he added.

34.title: Gagandeep Kang to join Gates foundation as director of global health: Reports
34.article_body: Virologist Gagandeep Kang will take up the role of director of global health at Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, as per reports. Her focus at the foundation will be on enteric diseases (gastrointestinal) and diarrhoeal infections, reports added. She is a professor at Vellore's Christian Medical College and is also part of National Technical Advisory Group on Immunization (NTAGI).

35.title: Punjab orders strict action against those selling Chinese kite strings
35.article_body: Punjab minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer on Tuesday said the state government has asked all Deputy Commissioners to take exemplary action against those selling Chinese kite strings. Recently, a 13-year-old boy died after a Chinese kite string got entangled around his neck in Rupnagar district. There is a blanket ban on the sale and use of such strings in Punjab.

36.title: US wholesale price inflation rises 0.2% in October, less than expected
36.article_body: US wholesale prices continued to rise in October but at a slower pace than in the prior month, according to official data from the Labor Department. The producer price index (PPI) rose just 0.2% compared to September, which was half the pace economists had expected. On a year-over-year basis, PPI rose 8% compared to an 8.4% increase in September.

37.title: Pressure was off me in 'No Way Home' as it was Tom's trilogy: Garfield
37.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield said the pressure was off him while filming 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' along with Tom Holland and Tobey Maguire. "It was all on Tom's shoulders. Like, it's his trilogy. And, Tobey and [I] were there to provide support and have as good a time as possible," he added. Tobey and Garfield had a cameo in the film.

38.title: Over 5 lakh people visited Aam Aadmi Clinics in last 4 months: Punjab govt
38.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday claimed that over 5 lakh people have visited Aam Aadmi Clinics during the last four months, adding that AAP is fulfilling the promise it made in its election manifesto. The Aam Aadmi Clinics across the state have received an overwhelming response and over 8,000 patients visit these clinics daily, Health Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra said.

39.title: Twitter is very slow in India, it's a fact: Elon Musk
39.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Twitter is very slow in India, Indonesia & many other countries. This is a fact, not "claim"." He added, "10 to 15 seconds to refresh homeline tweets is common. Sometimes, it doesn't work at all, especially on Android phones." Earlier, Musk publicly fired an employee working on Twitter's Android app.

40.title: Rohit Sharma pays tribute to Kieron Pollard in his 1st post after India's T20 WC exit
40.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to pen his first post on social media following India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022. In the post, he paid tribute to Kieron Pollard, who announced his retirement from IPL. "Big man...big impact and always played with heart...A true MI legend," he wrote. Pollard will be MI's batting coach in IPL 2023.

41.title: Novak Djokovic granted visa to play in 2023 Australian Open: Reports
41.article_body: Novak Djokovic has been granted a visa to play in Australian Open in January 2023, reports stated. Djokovic was deported to Serbia from Australia ahead of Australian Open 2022 after he declined to be vaccinated against coronavirus. The former world number one was originally handed a ban from entering the country until 2025. The ban has reportedly now been overturned.

42.title: At this rate, no one will be left to run Twitter: Engineer publicly fired by Musk
42.article_body: Eric Frohnhoefer, Twitter's Android app developer who was publicly fired by Elon Musk after an argument, said, "Woke up to the news that more Tweeps were summarily fired last night." He added, "At this rate, no one will be left to run Twitter." Notably, Twitter has already fired 50% of its global workforce and 90% of its India team.

43.title: Want to do all kinds of films, play all kinds of characters: Irrfan's son Babil
43.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil, when asked how he plans to chart out his journey in the film industry, said he's not even attempting to do that. "Because we've...illusion, we think we're in control of our journey, we aren't...I want to do all kinds of films, play all kinds of characters," said Babil, who'll make his debut with 'Qala'.

44.title: India approves 'vostro' accounts for nine banks to push trade in rupees
44.article_body: Federal trade secretary Sunil Barthwal said India has given nine banks approval to open "vostro" accounts to help facilitate trade with Russia in rupees. Barthwal added that three out of the nine accounts have already been opened. Barthwal said Gazprom had opened an account with UCO Bank, and VTB Bank and SberBank have opened accounts with their India-based branch offices.

45.title: Government raises base import prices of palm oil, gold & silver
45.article_body: The government has raised the base import prices of gold, crude and refined palm oil, Ministry of Finance said on Tuesday. The revised price of crude palm oil is $960 per metric tonne while refined palm oil is $988 per metric tonne. New prices for gold and silver are $570 per 10 grams and $702 per kg, respectively.

46.title: Gujarat CM to file nomination for Assembly polls tomorrow
46.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel will file his nomination for the upcoming state Assembly elections on Wednesday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah will also be present. Shah on Tuesday said that the ruling BJP will break all previous records in the elections and again form government in the state with a huge majority by winning the highest-ever seats.

47.title: EU announces revised target to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
47.article_body: The European Union (EU) announced a revised target to cut down greenhouse gas emissions at COP27 in Egypt on Tuesday. The existing goal for 2030 was to reduce emissions by 55% compared to 1990 levels. This target has now been revised to 57%. "Don't let anybody tell you...the EU is backtracking," said an EU official.

48.title: Germany opens first floating LNG terminal in North Sea
48.article_body: Germany opened the country's first floating terminal for liquefied natural gas (LNG) at the North Sea port of Wilhelmshaven on Tuesday. The facility, which will house a floating storage and regasification unit ship, is expected to be an alternative to the pipeline fuel supplied by Russia. Russia has stopped supplying gas to Germany amidst the war with Ukraine.

49.title: RBI imposes fine on 9 cooperative banks for violating norms
49.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed monetary penalties on nine cooperative banks over deficiencies in regulatory compliance. The bank regulator has fined two banks each from Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Odisha and one each from Maharashtra, Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh. The penalties imposed on these lenders range from ₹25,000 to ₹3,10,000.

50.title: Was a blessing that Kashyap gave me an iconic role in 'Gangs...': Aditya
50.article_body: Actor Aditya Kumar, who played the role of Perpendicular in his debut film 'Gangs of Wasseypur 2', said, "I take it as a blessing...privilege that Anurag Kashyap sir gave me that iconic role." He added that his debut film set the bar too high. "I am yet to get a role that can match its standard," Aditya further stated.

51.title: Public servants mustn't make disparaging remarks on countrymen: SC
51.article_body: The Supreme Court said public servants should not make remarks that are "disparaging" or "insulting" to countrymen. The court added that it is an "unwritten rule" and is part of the "constitutional culture" and therefore, there was no need for a code of conduct. "This must be inculcated in our political society and our civic life," Justice BV Nagarathna observed.

52.title: Won't interfere until there's collapse of constitutional machinery: Kerala Guv
52.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Tuesday said he won't interfere in the business of the state government unless there's a total collapse of the constitutional machinery. He went on to say, "Fortunately, that situation does not prevail in Kerala." State government should also respect their limits and it's not their job to run universities, Khan added.

53.title: Fodder inflation at 27.31%, highest since 2013: WPI Report
53.article_body: The annual rate of fodder inflation reached 27.31% in October 2022, which is the highest since 2013, according to the All-India Wholesale Price Index (WPI) data. The WPI-based fodder inflation in October last year was 8.85%. The WPI data was released by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry's Office of the Economic Adviser.

54.title: Financial Services Secy Vivek Joshi nominated as director on RBI's central board
54.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday nominated Secretary of the Department of Financial Services Vivek Joshi as a director on the central board of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "The nomination of Shri Vivek Joshi is effective from November 15, 2022 and until further orders," RBI said in a release. The board has 15 seats, of which five are official directors.

55.title: Married Jaya Bachchan because of her long hair: Amitabh Bachchan
55.article_body: A promo for the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14' showed Amitabh Bachchan praising a contestant's long hair. He also revealed that he married Jaya Bachchan because she had very long hair. Amitabh and Jaya first met during the shoot of Hrishikesh Mukherjee's 1971 film 'Guddi'. They tied the knot in 1973.

56.title: Zambia seeks answers from Russia on death of citizen in Ukraine war
56.article_body: Zambia has sought explanations from Russia on how one of its citizens who had been serving a prison sentence in Moscow ended up on the battlefield in Ukraine, where he was killed, Zambia's Foreign Minister said on Monday. The minister said that Russia had notified Zambia about Lemekhani Nyirenda's death in September but did not provide any details.

57.title: Top seed Nadal loses 2nd straight Green Group match at ATP Finals
57.article_body: Top seed Rafael Nadal lost his second straight match in the Green Group at ATP Finals in Turin on Tuesday. Fifth seed Felix Auger-Aliassime beat Nadal 6-3, 6-4 to register his maiden win at the season finale. This is the 22-year-old Canadian's first-ever win over Nadal. The Spaniard will now face Norwegian Casper Ruud in his final round-robin match.

58.title: Djokovic beats 2nd seed Tsitsipas for 9th straight time at ATP Finals
58.article_body: Novak Djokovic defeated second-seeded Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-4, 7-6(7-4) for his ninth straight win against the Greek in the players' opening match of Red Group at ATP Finals on Monday. The 21-time Grand Slam champion has beaten Tsitsipas in his third straight tournament following wins in Astana and at Paris Masters. Djokovic won the match in one hour and 37 minutes.

59.title: Hardik is obviously a superstar of the game: Kane ahead of India-NZ T20Is
59.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya ahead of India-New Zealand T20I series, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said the India all-rounder is "obviously a superstar of the game". "I have played a lot against him. He is one of the most sought-after match-winners, given the fact that he is an all-rounder," he added. Hardik will lead India in the three-match series.

60.title: Focus on rectifying legal system: Cong to Rijiju over Nehru remarks
60.article_body: After Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that Jawaharlal Nehru didn't act in the country's interests over Kashmir, Congress asked him to focus on rectifying "a legal system that frees those convicted of murder and gang rape". "He should be more anguished by these than defaming Nehru!" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said on Twitter. Ramesh called Rijiju's article on Nehru "fraudulent".

61.title: Centre destroying Kerala's higher education sector: Sitaram Yechury
61.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said that the central government was misusing the Governor's office to destroy the higher education sector in Kerala. Yechury inaugurated a mega protest to the Raj Bhavan by the ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF). "In all matters of education, the BJP-led Union government is bypassing the states," he said.

62.title: Minor tied to tree, beaten up over suspicion of theft in Rajasthan
62.article_body: A minor boy was tied to a tree and beaten up on suspicion of being a thief in Rajasthan's Sikar. A video of the incident, which occurred about four months ago, also surfaced online. The victim's mother alleged police inaction and said the Class 4 student had gone to a plot owned by the accused and picked up cards.

63.title: I have never been in a solid relationship in all my 50 years: Karan
63.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar in a recent interview said that he has never been in a "solid relationship" in his life. "There have been fleeting instances that I felt could have been a relationship, but it never fructified. I'm the first one to run out," the 50-year-old director said, adding, "I also feel like I'm really messed up in that department."

64.title: Industrialist met Jay Shah, is trying to lure Cong MLAs into BJP: Cong
64.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has alleged that an Indore-based industrialist is involved in the process of luring Congress MLAs to join the BJP. He added, "I've information that...[the] industrialist...met Jay Shah (Home Minister Amit Shah's son)...[and] told him that he can manage some MLAs for the BJP." This comes amid speculations that some Congress legislators are planning to switch sides.

65.title: Youth invited for dinner in Bihar, beaten to death
65.article_body: A youth was beaten to death in Bihar's East Champaran district over a case of personal enmity, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Mukesh Yadav, and his family members assaulted Chandip Yadav at their home after inviting him for dinner. Chandip's mother raised an alarm when he failed to return home. Thereafter, villagers found him lying unconscious at Mukesh's home.

66.title: Over 50 policemen deployed at Tiruchi camp for Rajiv Gandhi assassination convicts
66.article_body: Over 50 police personnel have been reportedly brought in from central and south zones for extra security at the special camp in Tiruchi, where four of the convicts of Rajiv Gandhi assassination case have been lodged. The convicts, Murugan, Robert Payas, Jayakumar and Santhan, were brought to the camp on Saturday from Puzhal and Vellore prisons following Supreme Court orders.

67.title: Jailed Egyptian-British activist has ended hunger strike, family says
67.article_body: Alaa Abdel-Fattah has ended his hunger strike, his family informed on Tuesday citing a letter they said was written by the jailed Egyptian-British political activist himself. The family said they received the letter through Egyptian prison authorities. Amnesty International had earlier warned that Abdel-Fattah could die, due to his hunger strike, amid the COP27 summit currently underway in Egypt.

68.title: Failure of 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' broke my heart: Bhansali
68.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said the failure of 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' broke his heart. He added he returned to his 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Devdas' style of filmmaking with 'Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela' after 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' failed. "Both the films are as precious to me as 'Ram-Leela'...somehow our efforts didn't connect with the audience," he added.

69.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra forced RSS chief to visit mosque: Digvijaya Singh
69.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said the Bharat Jodo Yatra has "compelled" RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat to visit a madrasa and a mosque. "PM Modi will also start wearing a topi (cap) in a few days," said Singh. He also claimed that PM Modi wears a "topi" in Saudi Arabia and other countries but avoids doing so in India.

70.title: Video shows Jacqueline getting mobbed, social media user says 'This is wrong'
70.article_body: Videos that have surfaced on social media show Jacqueline Fernandez leaving court premises on Tuesday afternoon after her bail hearing. She can be seen getting mobbed by camerapersons, journalists, and bystanders. Reacting to this, a person wrote, "This is wrong. I don't think this is the way to hound someone," while another comment read, "This has such Rhea Chakraborty vibes."

71.title: MS Dhoni likely to help Team India prepare for T20 World Cup 2024: Report
71.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni is likely to work with Team India's T20I set-up to prepare for T20 World Cup 2024, as per reports. The BCCI is planning to hold talks with MS Dhoni to offer him a role in some capacity, reports added. Notably, Dhoni was mentor of Team India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad.

72.title: Army installs 3D-printed bunkers that can withstand tank fire in eastern Ladakh
72.article_body: The Indian Army has set up 3D-printed permanent defences (bunkers) at the Line of Actual Control in eastern Ladakh. The bunkers can withstand blasts and tank fire, can be erected within 36-48 hours and can be moved from one place to another, Indian Army's Engineer-in-chief Lieutenant General Harpal Singh said. They have been trial tested against a range of weapons.

73.title: Karan reveals he started wearing oversized clothes after being body-shamed
73.article_body: Karan Johar revealed that he hasn't accepted his body, even though it's been years since he was first teased for his weight. "That's why I have a big problem with fitted clothes," he said. "Now...I wear these oversized clothes, but I actually can't bear any tight thing...I don't believe I have a waistline or physique for it," he added.

74.title: He revolutionised Telugu cinema: Rajamouli on actor Krishna's demise
74.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, mourning the demise of veteran Tollywood actor Krishna, wrote on Twitter, "He revolutionised Telugu cinema with first 70mm film, first colour film and many more." "He taught us not to be afraid of taking the untreaded path," he added. Krishna, father of Mahesh Babu, passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest.

75.title: Morbi bridge collapse highlights cronyism in Gujarat: Congress
75.article_body: The Morbi bridge collapse, which killed 135 people, highlighted the 'cronyism being perpetuated by the BJP government' in Gujarat, the Congress alleged on Tuesday. "The model is that you benefit a few industrialists and leave behind the rest and that leads to a lot of social and economic disparities," said Congress spokesperson Anshul Avijit.

76.title: Delhi BJP releases song sung by MP Manoj Tiwari for MCD polls
76.article_body: The BJP's Delhi unit released its campaign song titled 'BJP ka matlab sewa hai' (BJP means service) for the upcoming MCD polls. Sung by MP Manoj Tiwari, the song narrates the "reality of Delhi", said Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta. It also reportedly accuses the AAP of turning the Yamuna into a "drain" and converting Delhi into a "gas chamber".

77.title: India's biggest iPhone manufacturing unit to come up near Hosur, to employ 60,000
77.article_body: The biggest unit to manufacture Apple's iPhone in India is coming up near Hosur, an industrial city in Tamil Nadu which is also close to Bengaluru, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. It will employ around 60,000 people. Speaking at the Janjatiya Gaurav Divas ceremony, Vaishnaw said 6,000 tribal women residing near Ranchi and Hazaribagh have been trained for making iPhones.

78.title: How much money can each IPL team spend in IPL 2023 auction?
78.article_body: A total of 163 players were retained by IPL franchises, while 85 players were released from existing squads. SRH will have the maximum amount to spend at ₹42.25 crore in the IPL 2023 auction. PBKS follow SRH with ₹32.2 crore. Meanwhile, defending champions GT can spend ₹19.25 crore, while KKR can spend ₹7.05 crore, the least amount among the franchises.

79.title: AAP launches theme song sung by its MLA for Delhi civic polls
79.article_body: The AAP has launched its theme song for the upcoming civic polls in Delhi titled 'MCD mein bhi Kejriwal' (Kejriwal in MCD as well). The 'Kejriwal in MCD' slogan is resonating everywhere and this is reflected in the song, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. The song has been sung by AAP's Timarpur MLA Dilip Pandey.

80.title: Supreme Court threatens to suspend striking lawyers in Odisha
80.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has threatened to suspend members of 20 district bar associations in Odisha if they don't call off their strike. "Public cannot be treated like this. This is ridiculous. At the end of the day, they are sufferers because of you," the apex court said while hearing an application filed by the Orrisa High Court.

81.title: BJP govt's welfare measures benefitting tribal community: CM Yogi
81.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said the BJP government has undertaken several welfare measures that are benefitting the tribal community. Addressing a gathering on 'Tribal Pride Day' in Sonbhadra, he said this is the only district in the country where so many tribal castes live together. Birsa Munda had a special place in India's freedom movement, he added.

82.title: Guptill is one of NZ's best white-ball cricketers ever: Williamson
82.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said his teammate Martin Guptill, who was dropped from the squad for upcoming T20I and ODI series against India, is one of New Zealand's best white-ball cricketers ever. He added that the 36-year-old opener brings a lot of good qualities to the team. Guptill is the leading run-scorer for New Zealand in T20Is.

83.title: India and US begin annual joint military drills in Uttarakhand
83.article_body: India and the US began their annual military exercise 'Yudh Abhyas' at a military facility in Uttarakhand on Tuesday. The US Army's soldiers from the Second Brigade of its 11th Airborne Division and Indian Army soldiers from the Assam Regiment are participating in the exercise. This year's edition will end in early December.

84.title: You are Sima Taparia of the industry: Twinkle Khanna to Karan Johar
84.article_body: Author Twinkle Khanna, during a conversation with Karan Johar, has said that the filmmaker is the Sima Taparia of the film industry because of his matchmaking skills. "You keep doing this matchmaking...your father did the same thing. When I was speaking to Waheeda Rehman, she mentioned...your father fixed up her marriage," she added.

85.title: Those who see Bharat as their motherland are Hindus: RSS chief
85.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said, "We have been telling since 1925...a person who believes Bharat is his mother and motherland is Hindu." "We had common ancestors. Every Indian who is part of the 40,000-year-old 'Akhand Bharat' has common DNA," he added. "Our ancestors had taught that everyone should stick to their faith," Bhagwat said.

86.title: Happy to play for new franchise: Shardul after being traded from DC to KKR
86.article_body: After being traded from Delhi Capitals (DC) to Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) ahead of IPL 2023, bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, in a video posted by KKR's official Twitter handle, said he's happy to play for the new franchise. "I'll always give my best...Very excited to meet new people...will play cricket the hard way. So Kolkata, here I come," he added.

87.title: Ex-Man Utd teammates Rooney and Neville are not my friends: Ronaldo
87.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo, during his interview with journalist Piers Morgan, claimed that former teammates Wayne Rooney and Gary Neville are not his friends. "They are not my friends, they are colleagues," said Ronaldo. He added that it was "hard" to hear Rooney and Neville's criticism and wondered if they had to criticise him to "be more famous".

88.title: 7th-tier English club makes 28-day loan offer for Man City's Haaland
88.article_body: English football's seventh-tier club Ashton United has made a 28-day loan offer for Manchester City forward Erling Haaland. As Haaland is not participating in the World Cup, Ashton said they could offer him match practice in the break before City's next game. "We think he...would slot in with our squad dynamic really well," said Ashton manager Michael Clegg.

89.title: US woman, boyfriend charged with killing sister, 3-week-old niece
89.article_body: A woman, along with her boyfriend, in the US state of California on Monday was charged with the murder of her sister and 3-week-old niece, prosecutors informed. The killings were motivated by jealousy and sibling rivalry, prosecutors said. Yarelly Solorio-Rivera and her boyfriend Martin Arroyo-Morales were each charged with two counts of murder and a special circumstance of multiple murders.

90.title: Really good boy: Man City manager Guardiola on rape-accused Mendy
90.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola reportedly termed rape-accused player Benjamin Mendy a "really good boy". The Spanish coach reportedly added that he is not Mendy's "father" and does not know what the player does in his private life. Mendy faces seven charges of rape, one charge of attempted rape and one charge of sexual assault against six young women.

91.title: Amit Shah's firmness made power transition smooth in Maha: Fadnavis
91.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said Union Home Minister Amit Shah's firmness helped in the smooth transition of power in the state. "Amit Shah offered his staunch support...Once he decides about a thing, he gets it done," said. He added that the BJP "countered the Shiv Sena's betrayal" and allied with the "original Shiv Sena" and form the government.

92.title: Delhi HC rejects Uddhav's plea against EC freezing Shiv Sena symbol
92.article_body: The Delhi High Court has dismissed former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's plea against the Election Commission's (EC) order to freeze Shiv Sena's bow and arrow symbol. The court also asked the EC to expedite the decision on the matter. In October, the EC directed both Eknath Shinde and Thackeray's factions to not use the name 'Shiv Sena' or the symbol.

93.title: School bus crashes off embankment in Kentucky; 18 children hurt
93.article_body: A school bus crashed off an embankment and landed on its side in the US state of Kentucky on Monday, leaving the driver and 18 children on board injured, authorities said. The crash occurred on a state highway near Salyersville in eastern Kentucky, the affected school district informed. The bus was reportedly carrying students from elementary school through high school.

94.title: Brazil, France and England favourites to win 2022 FIFA WC: Messi
94.article_body: Argentina forward Lionel Messi has picked Brazil, France and England as favourites to win the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "Whenever we talk about candidates, we always talk about the same teams...But the World Cup is...so complicated that anything can happen," said Messi. Argentina's opening Group C match is against Saudi Arabia, after which they face Mexico and Poland.

95.title: Bihar govt extends deadline for caste-based census till May
95.article_body: The Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday granted a three-month extension to general administrative department to submit a detailed report about the caste-based census. The department was asked to complete the caste-based census by February next year. This decision was taken due to hectic engagement of officials in the examinations and revision of electoral rolls.

96.title: Telangana Congress leader Pawar Patel resigns, likely to join BJP
96.article_body: Pawar Ramarao Patel, the President of Nirmal District Congress Committee in Telangana, resigned from his position and primary membership of the party on Monday. He resigned after holding a meeting with his supporters in Bhainsa town. As per reports, Patel will join the BJP on November 28. Ex-MLA Alleti Maheshwar Reddy said Patel was a senior Congress member in Nirmal.

97.title: 1,001 examples of Kerala govt interfering with universities: Guv
97.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan said he could give 1,001 examples of the state government interfering with the daily functioning of universities. Khan added that he would resign if anyone could cite one example where he tried to interfere in the state government's business. "Universities have become fiefdoms of the party cadre and their relatives," said Khan.

98.title: Walmart agrees to pay $3.1 billion to settle opioid lawsuits in US
98.article_body: Walmart said it has agreed to a $3.1 billion settlement plan, resolving allegations of contributing to the nationwide opioid crisis by failing to regulate prescriptions at its stores. Walmart said that it "strongly disputes" allegations in lawsuits from state and local governments in the US. Lawyers representing governments said Walmart would pay most of the settlement over the next year.

99.title: Russian airstrikes reported in cities across Ukraine including Kyiv
99.article_body: Russia launched airstrikes on many Ukrainian cities including residential buildings in Kyiv on Tuesday, days after Ukraine retook the southern city of Kherson. At least 10 regions and cities were targeted in Tuesday's strikes which included missile attacks. Power and energy facilities were struck across Ukraine even as air raid alerts were issued.

100.title: Excited that it's ending, want to do other things: Harbour on 'Stranger Things'
100.article_body: Actor David Harbour, who plays the role of Jim Hopper in 'Stranger Things', has said he's "excited" that the show is ending with its upcoming fifth season. "I'm excited to do other things. There [are] so many other things which I want to do," he added. Talking about his character, David said, "It's my favourite character that I've ever played."

101.title: Witness against Sadhvi Pragya in Malegaon blasts case turns hostile
101.article_body: A witness, who reportedly gave a statement against Bhopal MP Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur and another accused in the Malegaon blasts case, has turned hostile. This is the 29th witness to turn hostile. On November 5, the previous witness who turned hostile told the NIA that he does not remember the statements he gave to the Maharashtra ATS.

102.title: Which IPL teams released the most players and which released the least?
102.article_body: KKR released the most players ahead of IPL 2023 auction, letting go of 16 players including Mohammad Nabi, Aaron Finch and Ajinkya Rahane. MI and SRH released 13 and 12 players, respectively, while PBKS and RR released nine players each. CSK released eight players, LSG released seven players, GT released six players, and DC and RCB released five players each.

103.title: Jadeja shares old pic of him bowing down to MS Dhoni after being retained by CSK
103.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Twitter to share an old picture of him bowing down to MS Dhoni after being retained by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) ahead of IPL 2023 auction. "Everything is fine #RESTART," he wrote alongside the picture. CSK released a total of eight players from the squad.

104.title: Over 95% of firms in India faced 'new frauds' in last 2 yrs: PwC survey
104.article_body: Over 95% of Indian companies/organisations faced "new types of fraud" in past two years as a result of the disruption caused by COVID-19, survey by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) showed. PwC added, "52% of Indian companies experienced fraud or economic crime in the last 24 months." New types of fraud include misconduct risk (67%), platform risk (38%) and cybercrime (31%), among others.

105.title: Poll panel to hear Lok Janshakti Party symbol dispute on Nov 29
105.article_body: The Election Commission of India has said that it will hear two factions led by Chirag Paswan and his uncle Pashupati Kumar Paras over the Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) symbol dispute on November 29. In October, both groups were barred from using the name of LJP or its symbol 'bungalow' till the dispute was settled by the EC.

106.title: FHRAI asks SEBI to bar OYO IPO again after CCI penalty
106.article_body: After the Competition Commission of India (CCI) recently penalised OYO, the Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) has asked SEBI to bar the travel-tech firm's IPO. Last year, the FHRAI had written to SEBI asking to halt the IPO process to protect other hoteliers in the country. OYO was fined ₹168.88 crore for unfair business practices.

107.title: Odisha govt announces ₹200 crore relief for drought-hit farmers
107.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday announced input assistance of around ₹200 crore for distressed farmers of drought-affected areas in the state. According to officials, about 2,63,560 hectares of cropland in 64 blocks and 15 urban local bodies of 12 districts have suffered crop loss of 33% and above due to drought.

108.title: LTIMindtree CEO rules out layoffs, full integration likely by FY23 end
108.article_body: LTIMindtree CEO Debashis Chatterjee said layoffs are unlikely post the LTI-Mindtree merger since the merger is aimed at better leveraging the talent pool. He added that the company aims to get back to profitable growth as it completes integration in the next two quarters. "Attrition has stabilised in the last two quarters, which I think will continue," he mentioned.

109.title: Weinstein penetrated my private parts with his fingers, raped me: US politician's wife
109.article_body: Jennifer Siebel Newsom, a documentary filmmaker and the wife of California's governor, testified that Harvey Weinstein raped her in 2005. She said when she met him at a hotel for what she thought was a business meeting, he began masturbating in front of her. Jennifer added Weinstein penetrated her private parts with his fingers and then his "deformed" penis.

110.title: Gujarat Titans release 6 players from their IPL 2022-winning squad
110.article_body: Defending champions Gujarat Titans have released six players from their IPL 2022-winning squad ahead of the IPL 2023 auction, which will take place on December 23. The players are Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Lockie Ferguson, Dominic Drakes, Gurkeerat Singh, Jason Roy and Varun Aaron. Gujarat Titans will have ₹19.25-crore purse to spend in the auction.

111.title: Who is MrBeast, the world's most-subscribed person on YouTube?
111.article_body: America's 24-year-old Jimmy Donaldson, known as 'MrBeast', beat PewDiePie to become the world's most-followed individual on YouTube with over 111 million subscribers. He originally posted video game playthroughs and later made videos of expensive stunts, philanthropic gestures and giveaways like giving away hundreds of cars and a private island. He also runs his virtual restaurant MrBeast Burger.

112.title: AAP's Vijay Nair, businessman Boinpally granted bail in Delhi excise policy case
112.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court has granted bail to AAP communication in-charge Vijay Nair and businessman Abhishek Boinpally in Delhi excise policy case. However, they won't be released from jail as ED has been granted five-day custody for further interrogation. All evidence collected during investigation is oral and there's no material documentary evidence, the court said while granting bail.

113.title: Shah's firmness helped in smooth transition of power in Maha: Dy CM
113.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah's firmness helped in the smooth transition of power in the state earlier this year, as BJP countered Shiv Sena's betrayal. "Shah not only has leadership qualities, but he holds the ability to deliver a decision in the right manner," Fadnavis said.

114.title: Iba Cosmetics raises $10 mn in Series B round led by Singapore-based Believe
114.article_body: Ahmedabad-based Iba Cosmetics, a vegan cosmetics and personal care brand, has raised $10 million in a Series B funding round led by Believe, a Singapore-based FMCG company. Believe has also bought over 50% stake in Iba, as per people close to the development. The startup sells products across verticals such as skincare, haircare and makeup.

115.title: UP minister Kapil Dev acquitted in disruption of train service case
115.article_body: A special court in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar has acquitted state minister Kapil Dev Aggarwal and seven other BJP leaders in a case related to the disruption of train service during a protest in 2012. The court announced the decision due to a lack of evidence. They were participating in a protest against the then UPA government at the Centre.

116.title: I'm impressed with Ayushmann's work, he picks up beautiful projects: Gajraj
116.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao said in an interview that he takes inspiration from Ayushmann Khurrana's "creative journey". "I'm very impressed with the work Ayushmann has been doing...It is interesting how he so bravely picks up such beautiful projects, such different projects," he added. Gajraj and Ayushmann shared screen space in 'Badhaai Ho' and 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'.

117.title: RSS, BJP attacking Birsa Munda's ideology: Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra
117.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said tribal leader Birsa Munda's ideology is being attacked by the RSS and BJP. Attending a Tribal Convention during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra's Hingoli, Rahul said, "They (BJP) have deep strategy behind changing the name of tribal people from 'Adivasi' to 'Vanvasi', and with this, they have seized many rights of them."

118.title: Sale of Pak-made Rooh Afza permanently banned on Amazon India by Delhi HC
118.article_body: The Delhi High Court has permanently restrained the sale of identical products under the 'Rooh Afza' trademark on Amazon India. This came after the Indian sherbet's maker Hamdard National Foundation filed a case against the e-commerce website and some sellers who were offering products of its Pakistani counterpart. The court earlier told Amazon India to remove Pakistan-made Rooh Afza's listings.

119.title: Haven't got invitation for Rahul Gandhi's Shegaon rally: Ajit Pawar
119.article_body: NCP MLA Ajit Pawar on Tuesday said Congress hasn't invited him for attending Rahul Gandhi's rally in Maharashtra's Shegaon. Senior NCP leaders might attend the rally if they are invited, he added. Earlier, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh announced that a grand public meeting would be held in Shegaon on Friday. NCP and Congress are part of Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance.

120.title: Female-led 'Pirates of...' film shelved by Disney, says Margot Robbie
120.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie has said the female-led 'Pirates of the Caribbean' has been shelved by Disney. The Australian actress stated, "We had an idea...we were developing it for a while, ages ago, to have more of a female-led...a different kind of story, which we thought would've been really cool." "But I guess, they don't want to do it," she concluded.

121.title: India ray of hope for world in 21st century: PM Modi in Indonesia
121.article_body: While addressing the Indian community in Indonesia's Bali, PM Narendra Modi said that India is a ray of hope for the world in the 21st century. "Today's India doesn't think small. Today India is doing work at unprecedented scale and speed," he said. PM added, "India's talent, technology, innovation and industry have made an identity for themselves before the world."

122.title: 'CM uncle' build toilets before painting K'taka schools: Congress
122.article_body: Expressing dissent over the proposed Viveka scheme by the state government, under which newly built classrooms will be painted in saffron colour, Congress said that CM Basavaraj Bommai should build toilets first. "CM uncle, before painting school buildings in saffron, first build toilets, give us hygienic drinking water and facilities that would attract children to schools," Congress tweeted.

123.title: 2,000 classrooms constructed in Kalyana Karnataka region: Bommai
123.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday announced the construction of 2,000 classrooms in Kalyana Karnataka region. The government has decided to construct additional classrooms in this region to solve the issue of shortage of classrooms for primary and secondary education, Bommai said. He added that ₹250 crore has been released towards construction and repairs of toilets in government schools.

124.title: Eating ultra-processed foods linked to premature death: Study
124.article_body: The consumption of highly processed foods can be linked to premature deaths, a study stated. As per researchers, ultra-processed foods (UPFs) like packaged baked snacks, ready-to-eat meals, frozen pizza, sugary drinks and cereals can cause adverse health conditions like obesity, dementia, and cancer. UPFs are low in protein and fibre, and heavy in added sugar, fat and salt, researchers added.

125.title: Headless body of woman with limbs chopped off found inside UP well
125.article_body: A body of a woman was found inside a well with its limbs chopped off and head missing in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh district on Tuesday, police said. "Efforts are being made to ascertain her identity after which details of age and her whereabouts would become clear," Azamgarh SP said. Forensic experts and dog squads had been called to the spot.

126.title: 2022 was a dream, might not happen again: Anupam on success of his films
126.article_body: Speaking about his successful run in films in 2022, Anupam Kher said the year was a dream for him that got fulfilled and might not happen again. Anupam featured in 2022 films like 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Karthikeya 2', which were successful at the box office. "I don't know which film of mine will do well next year," he added.

127.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a historic movement, will benefit Congress: Pilot
127.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Tuesday said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a historic movement that will benefit the Congress in the days to come. "Not just Congress supporters but...common people too are enthusiastic about the yatra," Pilot said. He added that BJP is upset because the yatra is getting huge support and will get "unexpected reception" in Rajasthan too.

128.title: MrBeast beats PewDiePie to become world's most-subscribed person on YouTube
128.article_body: American YouTube personality Jimmy Donaldson, better known as 'MrBeast', has overtaken Swedish YouTuber Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg (PewDiePie) to become the most-subscribed individual on YouTube. On Tuesday, MrBeast crossed 111.9 million subscribers against PewDiePie's over 111.8 million subscribers. India's T-Series remains the world's most subscribed YouTube channel with 229 million subscribers.

129.title: NASA to launch Artemis 1 Moon rocket on November 16
129.article_body: After two failed attempts, NASA is all set to launch its Artemis 1 Moon rocket on November 16. The mission's SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft will be launched from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida at 11.34 am IST. NASA will start live streaming of the tanking operations from 2 am IST on its official website, app and YouTube.

130.title: 55-yr-old woman dies due to suffocation at overcrowded temple in MP
130.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died due to suffocation at an overcrowded temple in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district on Tuesday. A large number of people had gathered to hear the sermons of a saint at the Dandraua Hanuman Mandir. Another woman was injured due to overcrowding and was taken to a health centre for treatment.

131.title: US woman caught twice with Mayan relics in Guatemala within a week
131.article_body: Two Americans have been arrested in Guatemala after police allegedly found 166 Mayan artefacts from the car they were travelling in, authorities said on Monday. One of the accused, a woman, was caught just a few days ago, on Thursday, trying to smuggle two Mayan relics out of the country, officials said. She was arrested and subsequently released on bail.

132.title: We opened over 320 mn bank accounts in India, more than US population: PM in Bali
132.article_body: PM Narendra Modi highlighted the achievements of his government in India while interacting with the Indian diaspora in Bali. Saying that India is the fastest-growing economy in the world today, PM Modi said, "Since 2014, we have opened more than 320 million bank accounts. More than the population of the USA." He added, "We don't dream small anymore."

133.title: Abhishek Bachchan says he keeps a scrapbook of bad reviews, criticisms
133.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan revealed that he keeps a scrapbook of bad reviews and criticisms that come his way. He added the idea came from his father Amitabh Bachchan. "He said 'Read it every day and...prove them wrong...use that as inspiration.' I took it a step further and made it 'They're telling...to improve...so let me read...on how to improve myself'," said Abhishek.

134.title: BJP fields former MLA Ashok Pincha for Sardarshahar bypoll in Raj
134.article_body: BJP on Tuesday announced former MLA Ashok Kumar Pincha as its candidate for the bypoll to the Sardarshahar Assembly constituency in Rajasthan. The seat got vacant after the death of Bhanwarlal Sharma in October this year. Pincha contested the 2018 elections from Sardarshahar against Sharma but lost by a margin of over 16,000 votes.

135.title: Class 6 girl accidentally swallows safety pin while adjusting hijab in Nagpur
135.article_body: A Class 6 girl reportedly swallowed a safety pin while adjusting her hijab at school in Maharashtra's Nagpur. When she started feeling uneasy, her parents took her to Mayo hospital, where the doctors found out that the pin was stuck in her windpipe. Doctors performed a non-invasive bronchoscopy on her and took out the pin safely.

136.title: Fawad Khan's Legend of Maula Jatt becomes highest-grossing Pakistani film
136.article_body: Fawad Khan's 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' has become the highest-grossing Pakistani film of all time by beating 'Jawani Phir Nahi Ani 2'. The film has reportedly collected over PKR 170 crore worldwide. Directed by Bilal Lashari, 'The Legend of Maula Jatt' also featured Mahira Khan, Humaima Malick and Hamza Ali Abbasi, among others.

137.title: Utter nonsense to keep India favourites for 2023 ODI WC at home: Vaughan
137.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said it is "utter nonsense" to keep India favourites for 2023 ODI World Cup at home. "England will be the team to beat without any question and that is going to be the case for a few more years to come," added the ex-England captain. England won their second T20 World Cup title on Sunday.

138.title: Head hangs in shame: HC on non-payment of aide for sewer death victims
138.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday criticised the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) for not paying compensation to the families of two persons who died inside a sewer this year. DDA was directed to pay ₹10 lakh compensation each to the families of the deceased. "My head hangs in shame," said Chief Justice Satish Chandra Sharma.

139.title: Govt strict, unsparing in dealing with religious conversions: Chhattisgarh CM
139.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said his government is strict and unsparing when it comes to dealing with forcible religious conversions. "We're a democracy where everyone has the right to choose the religion that he or she wants to practice," Baghel said. "But if someone is forced into...conversion, there's a provision for strict action against them in our state," he added.

140.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' actor Mayur Vakani creates PM Modi's sculpture, shares pics
140.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Mayur Vakani, who plays the character Sundar, recently shared photos of the sculpture he has created of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Mayur took to his official Instagram account and shared a couple of photos in which he can be seen working on the sculpture. "'SELFIE WITH PM', final touch up," he captioned his post.

141.title: Watching Man Utd vs Arsenal with Anisha is interesting time: Ranveer
141.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is a fan of football club Arsenal, has said that his sister-in-law Anisha Padukone is a Manchester United fan and watching the match between the two is "always an interesting time". "I lucked out that both my best friends are also Arsenal fans because things can get out of hand during banter," he added.

142.title: CSK have a lot of work to do, Dhoni's best cricket is behind him: Harbhajan
142.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said going forward CSK have a lot of work to do, adding MS Dhoni's best cricket is behind him as well. "Yes, he's the best captain today also. If you make him stand as a captain, you will not get that value from any other captain," he added. CSK have won four IPL titles under Dhoni's captaincy.

143.title: Telangana CM inaugurates 8 newly-established govt medical colleges
143.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday virtually inaugurated the commencement of classes in eight new medical colleges in the state. With this, over 1,150 first year MBBS students began their medical education in towns including Sangareddy, Mahabubabad, Mancherial, Jagtial, Wanaparthy, Kothagudem, Nagarkurnool and Ramagundam. KCR called it a golden chapter in the history of Telangana state.

144.title: Chennai Super Kings retain Ravindra Jadeja ahead of IPL 2023
144.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) have retained all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja ahead of IPL 2023. Sharing a picture, CSK tweeted, "Eighth wonder to stay with us!" Jadeja, who was named CSK captain for IPL 2022, was replaced as captain mid-tournament. He was later ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury. Earlier, reports of rift between Jadeja and CSK had surfaced online.

145.title: Kerala govt issues alert in 7 districts as dengue cases spike
145.article_body: The Kerala government on Tuesday sounded an alert in seven districts of the state against the spread of dengue fever. State Health Minister Veena George said dengue cases were on the rise in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Palakkad, Kozhikode and Malappuram. The administration has planned weekly dry day campaigns by cleaning public places and homes and removing stagnant water.

146.title: Direct tax collection to exceed budget target by 25-30%: Tax Board chief
146.article_body: Central Board of Direct Taxes Chairman Nitin Gupta said the direct tax collection in the current fiscal is likely to exceed the budget target of ₹14.20 lakh crore by about 25-30%. A 25-30% growth would take the net direct tax collection to ₹17.75-₹18.46 lakh crore. Gupta added that the next budget could bring changes in TDS provision for online gaming.

147.title: MP Minister Pradhuman Tomar massages patients' feet; video surfaces
147.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Energy Minister Pradhuman Singh Tomar on Monday evening visited a cataract treatment camp in Gwalior and gave foot massages to elderly patients present there. A video of the incident showed Tomar interacting with a patient at the camp. Tomar stayed at the camp over the night, served breakfast to the patients on Tuesday and also ate with them.

148.title: PM Modi interacts with Chinese Prez for 1st time since border clashes, pics released
148.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday interacted with Chinese President Xi Jinping during the G20 gala dinner in Indonesia's Bali. This is the first time the two leaders were seen interacting face-to-face since the clashes along the India-China border in 2020. PM Modi and Jinping came face-to-face during the SCO Summit in Samarkand in September but there was no interaction.

149.title: I-T Dept raids 30 locations linked to Maha SP chief's close aides
149.article_body: The Income Tax Department has raided over 30 locations in Varanasi, Kanpur, Lucknow, Mumbai and Kolkata linked to Maharashtra SP President Abu Asim Azmi's close aides during a probe related to benami property investments and black money. The properties are linked to late Ganesh Gupta and his wife Abha Ganesh Gupta. Officials said some other politicians will also be investigated.

150.title: FTX says it could have over 1 million creditors in new bankruptcy filing
150.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX expects to have over 1 million individual creditors, the company said in its first bankruptcy filing. The documents revealed that FTX "faced a severe liquidity crisis", and was in contact with financial regulators. As per the filing, five new independent directors have been appointed at each of FTX's main companies, including trading firm Alameda Research.

151.title: 7 apes being smuggled in boxes from Myanmar rescued in Assam
151.article_body: Seven apes, allegedly smuggled in boxes from Myanmar, were rescued in Assam's Hailakandi district on Monday night, police said. Two people were arrested after police chased their vehicle for almost 10 kilometres. Police said the apes were smuggled through Mizoram and the consignment was going towards Meghalaya.

152.title: KTR seeks Centre's nod for Hyd Metro Phase II project worth ₹8,000 cr
152.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) has requested the central government to provide preliminary clearance for the Hyderabad Metro Phase II project. He urged Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri to include the project in the ensuing union budget for fiscal year 2023-24. The new metro line from BHEL to Lakdikapul, estimated to cost ₹8,453 crore, will include 23 stations.

153.title: Probe against promoter will not impact Jet Airways deal: Kalrock Capital
153.article_body: Kalrock Capital said the ongoing investigation related to its promoter Florian Fritsch in foreign jurisdictions will have no impact on the acquisition of Jet Airways. Last week, multiple properties linked to Fritsch were raided by prosecutors in a criminal investigation. Kalrock-Jalan consortium had won the bid to revive Jet Airways after the airline filed for bankruptcy in 2019.

154.title: SEBI amends rules for appointment, removal of independent directors
154.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) introduced a new option for the appointment and removal of independent board of directors, for flexibility in the approval process. As per the new rule, the appointment and removal of independent directors could be done by two thresholds, ordinary resolution and majority of minority shareholders. Currently, it's done through a special resolution.

155.title: Today's fertilizer shortage is tomorrow's food crisis: PM Modi at G-20
155.article_body: During his address at the G-20 summit, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Today's fertilizer shortage is tomorrow's food crisis, for which the world will not have a solution." "We should build mutual agreement to maintain the supply chain of both manure and food grains stable and assured," he added. PM Modi was addressing a session on food and energy security.

156.title: Unimaginable shame: Murthy on 70 kids' death from India-made syrups in Gambia
156.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said that the death of 70 children in Gambia from India-made cough and cold syrups brought "unimaginable shame" to the country. He added it dented the credibility of India's pharmaceutical regulatory agency. He also stressed that India faces huge challenges in the field of research in sciences.

157.title: Govt asks state-owned firms to consider insolvency court to shut units
157.article_body: The Central Government has asked state-owned firms to consider moving the country's insolvency court to shut loss-making units, hoping for speedier resolutions. Public sector companies will have to file an insolvency application under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code for the resolution of a loss-making unit within three months of approval from a committee comprising top cabinet ministers.

158.title: Which players have been released by CSK ahead of IPL 2023 auction?
158.article_body: Chennai Super Kings, who finished ninth in IPL 2022, have released eight players from their squad and retained 18 players. Dwayne Bravo, Adam Milne, Chris Jordan, N Jagadeesan, C Hari Nishaanth, K Bhagath Varma, KM Asif and Robin Uthappa have been released. Uthappa had retired from all forms of Indian cricket on September 14.

159.title: Mamata Banerjee serves pakoras at roadside tea stall in WB; video surfaces
159.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stopped her convoy at a roadside tea stall in Jhargram and started serving pakoras to people. A video of the incident showing Banerjee wrapping the pakoras in paper and handing them out to people has surfaced online. She visited Jhargram to celebrate the birth anniversary of tribal freedom fighter Birsa Munda on Tuesday.

160.title: 6 injured as car hits e-rickshaw near Noida's Amity University
160.article_body: Two college students were taken into police custody after their car hit an e-rickshaw in Noida, injuring six people, including two school girls, an official said. The incident took place around 8:30 am near Amity University, the official said. Out of the six injured people, three suffered severe injuries for which they were hospitalised, said DCP (Noida) Harish Chander.

161.title: Delhi HC issues notice on lack of equipment in veterinary hospitals
161.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has issued a notice on the lack of equipment in the 77 government veterinary hospitals and dispensaries in the city. The notice was issued after the court heard a public interest litigation by three social workers who sought directions for the Veterinary Council of India, the Delhi government and the Animal Welfare Board of India.

162.title: Belief that my films will be superhits makes me work 18 hrs a day: SRK
162.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said he has faith that all his upcoming films will be successful at the box office. "I'd like to explain the lack of arrogance in this statement...That is the belief that makes me, at the age of 57, go do stunts, jump, work 18 hours a day," he added. SRK will next feature in 'Pathaan'.

163.title: It is very exciting when you have ability to bowl 150 plus: Kane on Umran
163.article_body: New Zealand batter Kane Williamson said that Indian pacer Umran Malik is a super exciting talent. "Spent time with him (Umran) last year and his raw pace was a real asset. Seeing him in the Indian international scene is an amazing rise," Williamson said. "When you have the ability to bowl 150 plus, it is very exciting," he added.

164.title: 2,012 candidates file nomination papers for MCD elections: Report
164.article_body: As many as 2,012 candidates filed their nomination papers for the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections, PTI reported. In total, 2,564 nominations were received by the election officials. The elections will be held on December 4 and counting will take place on December 7. In 2017, the BJP won 181 wards of the 270 wards in total.

165.title: 7 MBBS students suspended for allegedly ragging juniors in Uttarakhand
165.article_body: Seven MBBS students of a medical college in Uttarakhand's Srinagar were suspended for allegedly ragging their juniors. The incident took place on November 11. The accused had allegedly abused their juniors and forced them to strip on the hostel roof. A panel which was set up by the institute to look into the matter reportedly found the seven students guilty.

166.title: Several injured as crude bombs hurled in clash in WB's Birbhum; 12 arrested
166.article_body: Several people were injured, and 12 were arrested after crude bombs were hurled during a clash between two groups in West Bengal's Birbhum on Monday. Several crude bombs were seized from the area. While BJP alleged it was an intra-party clash within Trinamool Congress (TMC), the latter called it "an apolitical clash that was a result of a personal feud".

167.title: Recalibrate meters by Nov 30: RTO to Mumbai taxis, autorickshaws
167.article_body: Regional Transport Office (RTO) said Mumbai taxis and autorickshaws will face a daily fine if they fail to recalibrate their meters as per the new fare structure by November 30. Autos and taxis would also face a one-day permit suspension for each day's delay. Till last week, only 4% of taxis and 11% of autos had updated their meters.

168.title: Google launches UPI Autopay for subscription-based purchases in India
168.article_body: Google has introduced UPI Autopay as a payment option for subscription-based purchases on Google Play in India. Launched under UPI 2.0 by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI Autopay helps customers make recurring payments using any UPI application that supports the feature. UPI Autopay is available alongside the existing credit and debit card, net banking and other options.

169.title: Turkey plans to pursue targets in northern Syria: Report
169.article_body: Turkey plans to pursue targets in northern Syria after it completes a cross-border operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq, a senior Turkish official told Reuters on Tuesday, following Sunday's bomb blast in Istanbul. Turkey has blamed Kurdish militants for the blast. Ankara will clear threats along its southern border "one way or another", the official added, declining to be named.

170.title: Mumbai Indians release 13 players ahead of IPL 2023 auction
170.article_body: Mumbai Indians have released 13 players ahead of IPL 2023 auction. They included Kieron Pollard, Anmolpreet Singh, Aryan Juyal, Basil Thampi, Daniel Sams, Fabian Allen, Jaydev Unadkat, Mayank Markande, Murugan Ashwin, Rahul Buddhi, Riley Meredith, Sanjay Yadav and Tymal Mills. Mumbai Indians will have nine slots to fill in the auction with a remaining purse of ₹20.55 crore.

171.title: It is a surreal feeling: Singer Armaan Malik on winning second EMA
171.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has reacted after he won his second MTV Europe Music Award 2022 (EMA) for his song 'You' in the Best India Act category. "It is a surreal feeling...I'm humbled and overjoyed to win my second EMA," he stated. Armaan won his first EMA for his track 'Control'. Speaking about 'You', Armaan called it "a very special record".

172.title: SoftBank writes off $100 mn investment in bankrupt crypto firm FTX: Report
172.article_body: SoftBank has reportedly written off about $100 million it invested as part of its Vision Fund 2 in now bankrupt crypto exchange FTX. SoftBank had backed FTX after the startup raised $400 million in January. According to the report, Softbank CFO Yoshimitsu Goto said that the $100-million Vision Fund invested in FTX as a minor stake in the company.

173.title: 126 children infected with measles in Mumbai this year
173.article_body: A one-year-old boy has died of measles in Mumbai while 126 children have contracted the viral disease this year in the city. A BMC official said the boy was undergoing treatment at Kasturba Hospital in Chinchpokli since last week and died on Monday. Civic officials have appealed to get children in the 9-16 age group fully vaccinated against the disease.

174.title: 1 killed, 30 hurt as bus going to Prez Murmu's event in MP overturns
174.article_body: One person was killed and over 30 were injured after a bus ferrying people to President Droupadi Murmu's tribal event in Madhya Pradesh overturned. The injured were rescued with the help of villagers, reports said, adding that those in critical condition were sent to different places for treatment. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed grief over the incident.

175.title: LGBTQI+ activist Gopi beaten by group of men in Delhi, hospitalised
175.article_body: A group of unidentified men allegedly beat LGBTQI+ activist Gopi Shankar Madurai near the latter's home in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Saturday.
