The intersex activist is currently admitted in a hospital with injuries on various parts of their body. DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said Madurai has received minor injuries. In January, Madurai was assaulted by six people in Tamil Nadu.

176.title: WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose steps down
176.article_body: WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose has stepped down from his role "to pursue another opportunity". Rajiv Aggarwal, Director of Public Policy Meta India, has also stepped down. The developments come days after Meta announced its biggest layoffs ever by cutting down its workforce by 11,000 employees across the globe.

177.title: Pune woman tricked into giving jewellery worth ₹1.3 lakh by fraudster
177.article_body: A 71-year-old woman in Pune was allegedly tricked into giving her gold jewellery worth ₹1.3 lakh by a fraudster. The woman was returning from her morning walk when the accused stopped her and told her that she had won lottery on her purchase of sarees recently. He asked her to take off her ornaments for weighing them and ran away.

178.title: Man shot at by 3 bike-borne suspects in Gurugram's Badshahpur
178.article_body: A 22-year-old man was shot at by three unidentified bike-borne suspects in Gurugram's Badshahpur area on Monday. The incident happened at around 10.30 pm when the victim, Ankit, and his friend, Himanshu, were standing outside another friend's house in Guga Colony, police said. Ankit has sustained an injury in his left eye and his condition is critical, police added.

179.title: If you won't use someone at ₹9 cr, put him back in auction: Moody on Shahrukh
179.article_body: On being asked whether PBKS should retain Shahrukh Khan in IPL 2023 auction, Tom Moody said, "If you aren't going to use someone at ₹9 crore and he's sitting on...bench...you put him back into...auction." Moody added that PBKS can bring Shahrukh back in the squad at a lesser price. Shahrukh scored 117 runs in eight matches in IPL 2022.

180.title: SRH release their most expensive player Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023
180.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) have released their captain and most expensive player Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023. The 32-year-old, who was earning ₹14 crore, spent eight years with them. He played 76 matches for the franchise. SRH have also released Nicholas Pooran. Both Pooran and Williamson are the captains of their respective national teams.

181.title: Microsoft, IIT Kanpur incubator collaborate to support startups
181.article_body: IIT Kanpur's Startup Incubation and Innovation Centre collaborated with Microsoft to launch the 'Azure Society of Excellence' to support startups. Under the programme, Microsoft will work with the incubator and give mentorship, employment and entrepreneurial opportunities. Startups at IIT Kanpur can also access various Microsoft resources to support their business plan and product development.

182.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra's impact will be felt in 2024 polls: Cong's Jairam
182.article_body: The impact of Congress's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will be felt in 2024 Loksabha elections and not in Assembly elections, party leader Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. Addressing the media, he said, "You will ask, what will be its impact in Gujarat or Himachal polls. It won't have any." "The Yatra will promote togetherness, it has united our party," he added.

183.title: Hindustani Bhau calls Urfi's outfits 'inappropriate', she reacts
183.article_body: Urfi Javed has reacted after YouTuber Vikas Fhatak aka 'Hindustani Bhau' commented on her dressing style and said that her clothes are inappropriate and don't suit Indian culture. Urfi said, "Suddenly he has...problem with what I wear after I refused to give him media attention! Case closed! Verdict- publicity hungry a**holes who can stoop to any level to get fame."

184.title: Cold wave hits Odisha with G Udayagiri recording 7.2°C
184.article_body: A cold wave has hit Odisha, with G Udayagiri in Kandhamal district recording the lowest temperature of 7.2°C on Tuesday. Apart from this, Semiliguda in Koraput district recorded a temperature of 9°C. Moreover, 20 places across the state recorded temperatures below 15°C. While Phulbani in Kandhamal district recorded 10.5°C, Daringbadi in Kandhamal and Bhawanipatna in Kalahandi recorded 11°C.

185.title: Tech Mahindra to come out with moonlighting policy this month
185.article_body: Tech Mahindra is set to unveil its moonlighting policy for employees this month, according to Global Chief People Officer Harshvendra Soin. Soin said the company is evaluating permitting side gigs as long as they do not obstruct the work and is only for a short period, such as over the weekend or a couple of hours in the week.

186.title: BSNL expected to roll out 4G services from January
186.article_body: State-run telecom giant Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) is expected to roll out 4G services from January next year, CNBC TV-18 reported. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has bagged the tender for the construction of towers to enable the rollout of the service, the report added. TCS will reportedly install one lakh towers over the next two years.

187.title: Should I now fall at PM Modi's feet & ask for funds for WB?: Mamata
187.article_body: Criticising the Central government for not releasing funds for 100 days' work and housing scheme for West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee asked if she should now fall at PM Modi's feet to ask for money. "You will take our money and then deprive us. What if we stop paying the tax?" Banerjee asked while addressing a gathering in Jhargram.

188.title: IITs have become victims of rote learning: Infosys Co-founder Murthy
188.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said that IITs have become victims of "rote learning", the memorisation of things based on repetition. "Thanks to the tyranny of coaching classes," he added. Murthy said that students should be able to relate what they learn in the classroom to the real world around them rather than passing examinations by rote learning.

189.title: Infosys to end work-from-home for employees, brings 3-phase hybrid work plan
189.article_body: Infosys is asking its employees to start reporting to offices in phases, putting an end to its work-from-home policy, an internal communication revealed. In the first phase, employees will be asked to come to offices twice a week. After that, they can relocate to a branch of their choice. Finally, Infosys will determine a work policy based on the feedback.

190.title: Manoj Bajpayee's best performance yet: Anurag on 'Gali Guleiyan'
190.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has praised Manoj Bajpayee's performance in 'Gali Guleiyan'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote that it is Manoj's "best performance yet". Manoj, while announcing the OTT release of his film, had said he was on the verge of losing his mental stability while preparing for the role. The film is written, directed and produced by Dipesh Jain.

191.title: Apple's job listings hint at 'metaverse' plans for its headset: Reports
191.article_body: Apple is looking for engineers to build its own 'metaverse' for its yet-to-be-announced mixed-reality (MR) headset, Bloomberg first reported. Job listings from Apple's Technology Development Group show that the company is looking for people to make its virtual and augmented reality headset, and build a video service with 3D content. The company's development of the headset was reported in 2021.

192.title: No water for 6 days, Jal Board unresponsive: Delhi's Vasant Kunj residents
192.article_body: Residents of Delhi's Vasant Kunj, Sector C-8, have alleged that there has been no water supply in the area for the last six days. They also claimed that the Delhi Jal Board has not been responding to their phone calls and online complaints adding they're now dependent on water tankers. Angry residents also staged protests holding empty buckets on streets.

193.title: 70 tonnes of missile fuel component found on ship to Yemen: US Navy
193.article_body: The US Navy said on Tuesday it found 70 tonnes of a missile fuel component aboard a Yemen-bound ship from Iran. The amount of ammonium perchlorate discovered can fuel more than a dozen medium-range ballistic missiles, the navy added. Iranian-backed Houthi rebels have used such projectiles against Yemen's allies and the Saudi-led coalition in the Yemeni Civil War.

194.title: Meghalaya BJP leader Bernard gets bail in 3-yr-old girl's rape case
194.article_body: Meghalaya High Court has granted bail to jailed BJP leader Bernard N Marak in a case related to the alleged rape of a three-year-old girl at his farmhouse. The court asked him not to leave the country or try to tamper with the evidence. He was earlier granted bail in connection with the running of a brothel in the farmhouse.

195.title: Retired Mumbai doctor loses ₹2.2 lakh to electricity bill fraud
195.article_body: A retired microbiologist, Dr Jayanthi Shashtri, from Mumbai's BYL Nair Hospital, allegedly lost ₹2.24 lakh to electricity bill fraud. According to police, Shashtri got a link to update her electricity bill payment status. After she filled the form and provided details of her credit card, she lost money in three transactions of ₹24,999, and three other transactions of ₹49,801.

196.title: Mumbai Police announce traffic restrictions for Bal Thackeray's death anniversary
196.article_body: Ahead of Bal Thackeray's 10th death anniversary, Mumbai Traffic Police have announced traffic restrictions around Dadar's Shivaji Park on Wednesday. No vehicles will be allowed on Swatantra Veer Savarkar Marg, Rajabadhe Chowk Junction, Dilip Gupte Marg, and Senapati Bapat Road to Lady Jamshedji Marg. Also, parking will be restricted on Keluskar Road, MB Raut Marg, Pandurang Naik Marg etc.

197.title: Man says Chicha's in Hyd charges double for water bottles, shares bill
197.article_body: An RTI activist tweeted on Monday that Chicha's restaurant in Hyderabad is charging customers ₹20 for a 500-ml water bottle which is worth ₹10. Sharing the restaurant's bill, Robin Zaccheus tweeted, "Clear exploitation and...violation of MRP." In response, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said, "Officers have been alerted on this issue and the same will be resolved at the earliest."

198.title: NCP MLA Jitendra Awhad gets anticipatory bail in molestation case
198.article_body: A Thane court granted National Congress Party (NCP) MLA and former Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad anticipatory bail on Tuesday on a bond of ₹15,000 in a molestation case. Awhad was booked for outraging the modesty of a BJP woman leader, who alleged that he pushed her on November 13 during a public event.

199.title: Elephant falls into well, JCB razes wall to rescue it in Andhra; video surfaces
199.article_body: An elephant fell into a well in the Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh on Monday and was rescued on Tuesday. A video of the rescue operation shows a JCB razing down a portion of a wall to help it climb out of the well. The operation was carried out by a joint team of forest officials and the fire department.

200.title: Don't like to lie: Diljit Dosanjh to journalist asking him for interview
200.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh replied to a journalist on Twitter after the latter asked the actor for an interview on the social media platform. He tweeted, "I don't like interviews...I...avoid them as much as I can. I don't like to lie...listening to the truth is difficult." "We have to live in this society where the truth is often crucified," he added.

201.title: Uddhav's Shiv Sena broke alliance for 4 seats in 2014: Devendra Fadnavis
201.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) and claimed that the party was dishonest with the BJP. "[In 2014], we were ready to form an alliance with Shiv Sena. However, Shiv Sena broke alliance for four seats. [The] BJP, which was contesting 117 to 118 seats, decided to contest 288 seats in one day," said Fadnavis.

202.title: BJP doesn't want to accept tribals, poor should get rights: Rahul
202.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BJP "attacks" the Constitution every day because it doesn't want to accept that Dalits, tribals and poor should get rights. While addressing a public meeting in Maharashtra's Washim district, Gandhi said tribals are the "original owners of the country" and their rights come first before anyone.

203.title: Interstate private bus catches fire in Telangana's Nirmal, no casualties
203.article_body: A private bus headed to Hyderabad from Nagpur, carrying 29 people, caught fire in Telangana's Nirmal on Tuesday morning. No injuries or casualties were reported due to the fire. "The driver observed smoke from the engine cabin. He immediately stopped the bus and alerted the passengers...[who]...got down immediately," police said, adding that a case has been registered.

204.title: In a first, child born at T3's medical facility, Delhi airport shares pic
204.article_body: In the first such episode, a baby was born at the Medanta medical facility at Terminal 3 of Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi. "Welcoming the youngest passenger ever! Celebrating the arrival of the first baby at Terminal 3, Medanta facility. Mother and child, both are doing well," the Twitter handle of the airport posted on Tuesday.

205.title: Commercial acting isn't easy, dare you to do what Rajinikanth does: Abhishek
205.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said that there is "an elite skill-set required" for acting in commercial films. In response to critics who look down upon commercial acting, Abhishek said, "I dare anybody to do what Rajini uncle (Rajinikanth) does...It's not easy." He said he'll be "impressed" if someone can pull off 'Devdas' with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Madhuri Dixit's "elan and grace".

206.title: Bahamas appoints liquidators to oversee collapsed FTX's unit
206.article_body: Financial regulators in the Bahamas appointed liquidators to run collapsed crypto exchange FTX's unit in the country. This move comes just days after authorities said they were looking for any "criminal misconduct" by FTX. FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday after traders withdrew $6 billion from the platform in just 72 hours and Binance cancelled a proposed rescue deal.

207.title: Cyberabad Police bust fake Meghalaya university certificate racket
207.article_body: Cyberabad Police busted a fake certificate racket on Monday and arrested six people for issuing fake certificates of Mahatma Gandhi University, Meghalaya. They also seized cash worth ₹50,000, 157 memos and letter pads of various universities. This comes after the accused took ₹2.07 lakh from a victim for fake certificates. University Director Milie Goel, who's the prime accused, is absconding.

208.title: 'Why this bias?' Umar on Archana Gautam's comeback in Bigg Boss 16
208.article_body: Umar Riaz, who featured in 'Bigg Boss 15', reacted to Archana Gautam's comeback in 'Bigg Boss 16' on Twitter after she was evicted for choking co-contestant Shiv Thakare. Umar tweeted, "Why the rules were different for me?" He added, "I was pushed in the task for which I reciprocated but every blame was put on me. Why this bias?"

209.title: No change in reservation status of Gujjars, Bakarwals: J&K LG Manoj Sinha
209.article_body: According to J&K LG Manoj Sinha, the reservation granted to the Pahari community in the valley will have no effect on the quotas of the Gujjar and Bakarwal communities. "Some people are trying to mislead the communities for political reasons, but I again reiterate...that there will [be] no change in the reservation quotas of Gujjars, Bakarwals...and Sippis," said Sinha.

210.title: May have to stop paying GST if Centre doesn't clear state's dues: CM Mamata
210.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said that if the Centre does not clear the state's dues, it may have to stop paying Goods and Services Tax (GST). "They are not releasing MNREGA funds. The BJP government has to step down from power if it does not clear our dues," CM Banerjee added.

211.title: Receiving shocking death threats for my kids: German Health Minister
211.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach has said that death threats targeting him and his family have become a regular part of his life. "I am...receiving shocking death threats for my children. Unfortunately, I can't go outside in the evening without personal security," Lauterbach said. Earlier this year, investigators uncovered an anti-state group that was allegedly planning to kidnap Lauterbach.

212.title: Indian groom's male friends wear saree and bindi at his wedding in US; video viral
212.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media that showed two groomsmen of an Indian groom arriving at his wedding venue in the US in sarees and bindi. The video showed the two men in saree walking down Michigan Avenue with the bride and surprising the groom. "That is so wholesome. Absolutely adorable," an Instagram user commented on the video.

213.title: A guy once asked me 'Are you a hard worker, or a smart worker?': Ranveer on casting couch
213.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, while speaking about encountering casting couch, told Deadline, "This guy calls me to this seedy place and is like, 'Are you a hard worker, or a smart worker?'" "I didn't consider myself to be smart, so I said, 'I think I'm a hard worker.' He was like, 'Darling, be smart, be sexy'," Ranveer added.

214.title: MI change profile picture on their social media handles to pay tribute to Kieron Pollard
214.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) changed profile picture on their social media handles to pay tribute to Kieron Pollard, who announced his retirement from IPL today. The profile picture included a photo of Pollard with words 'Forever MI' written on it. Pollard played a total of 13 IPL seasons for MI, scoring 3,412 runs and taking 69 wickets.

215.title: Let's normalise crying at workplace: Sugar CEO Vineeta Singh
215.article_body: In a video from a podcast, Sugar Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh said, "Let's normalise crying at the workplace. It's self-expression, not a 'breakdown'." Singh, who shared the clip on her social media handles, added that normalising crying at a workplace for men and women would be a huge cultural shift that organisations with a lot of women can bring about.

216.title: Owl Labs raises $25 mn in Series C round led by HP Tech Ventures
216.article_body: Owl Labs, a US-based startup that develops AI-powered hardware, has secured $25 million in a Series C funding round led by HP Tech Ventures. The funding round saw participation from Sourcenext, Matrix Partners, Spark Capital and Playground Global. The company was founded in 2014 by Mark Schnittman and Max Makeev.

217.title: Hatman Killer video completely fake, request to not share it: Mumbai Police
217.article_body: After a video of 'Hatman Killer' showing a stabbing incident of a woman went viral, Mumbai Police took to Twitter to say that it is "completely fake". "We have confirmed the clip is completely fake [and] request all to not share it for it furthers chaos and panic," the police added. They used "Fake News Alert" and "Fact Check" hashtags.

218.title: Nice to see crucial roles written for Indian actors: Richa Chadha
218.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha said that she feels "nice" that "crucial roles" are being written for Indian actors in international projects. Richa is set to play the lead role in an Indo-British production, helmed by a British director. While the actress didn't reveal details of the project, she said, "The story is interesting and I really liked my character."

219.title: No merger with Chirag Paswan until he makes public apology: RLJP chief
219.article_body: RLJP chief Pashupati Kumar Paras rejected reports of his party merging with LJP (Ram Vilas) headed by Chirag Paswan. "For rapprochement to take place, Chirag will have to atone and make a public apology over his decision to fight 2020 Bihar Assembly election alone," Paras said. He also claimed that Chirag returned to NDA only after BJP took his permission.

220.title: Cat licence must, ₹500 fine in Pune if owners fail to clean faeces
220.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Tuesday made it mandatory for owners to get pet licences for their cats. After receiving several complaints about sanitation problems created by pets like cats, PCMC has also decided to impose a fine of ₹500 on the owners if they refuse to clean their pet cats' faeces.

221.title: UNGA calls upon Russia to make reparations in Ukraine for wrongful acts
221.article_body: The UN General Assembly (UNGA) voted on a resolution to recognise that Russia must make reparations for its conduct in Ukraine. The resolution, supported by 94 out of 193 members, stated that Russia "must bear the legal consequences of all of its...wrongful acts, including making reparation for the injury...damage". Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called the resolution an "important" one.

222.title: Jacqueline Fernandez gets bail in ₹200-crore money laundering case
222.article_body: Delhi's Patiala House Court on Tuesday granted bail to actress Jacqueline Fernandez in the ₹200-crore money laundering case that involved conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. She was granted bail on a personal bond of ₹2 lakh and one surety of the same amount. The actress can travel abroad with prior permission of court.

223.title: BWF World Tour Finals moved from Guangzhou to Bangkok due to COVID-19
223.article_body: The upcoming BWF World Tour Finals has been moved from Guangzhou, China, to Bangkok, Thailand, due to COVID-19 situation in the Chinese city, Badminton World Federation announced on Tuesday. The tournament will begin on December 7, a week earlier than originally scheduled. This is due to stadium availability and a consequence of the change in location.

224.title: Amazon launches virtual healthcare space Amazon Clinic in US
224.article_body: Amazon.com on Tuesday launched Amazon Clinic, which is a virtual platform for common healthcare conditions such as allergies, acne and asthma, in the US. This is a move towards expanding the e-commerce giant's presence in the US healthcare space. This development comes only months after it agreed to buy primary care provider One Medical for $3.49 billion.

225.title: Our James Bond: Andhra Pradesh CM on demise of Telugu actor Krishna
225.article_body: Condoling the demise of the veteran Telugu actor Krishna, Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy said that Mahesh Babu's father was "our James Bond". CM Reddy said that his demise is a great loss for the Telugu people and the film industry. Krishna passed away in Hyderabad after suffering from cardiac arrest.

226.title: Foreign currency worth ₹1.52 cr seized by DRI at Amritsar, Chandigarh airports
226.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence sleuths seized foreign currency worth ₹1.52 crore from three passengers at the Amritsar and Chandigarh airports. At Amritsar International Airport, foreign currency worth ₹1.08 crore, hidden in cavities made in the luggage of two Dubai-bound passengers, was seized. In Chandigarh, foreign currency worth ₹44 lakh was seized from another Dubai-bound passenger.

227.title: Body found stuffed inside suitcase at Jalandhar railway station
227.article_body: The body of a man was found stuffed inside a suitcase outside a railway station in Punjab's Jalandhar on Tuesday. A passerby had reportedly informed the police about the suitcase. "We're scanning the CCTV footage in which a man in his mid-30s was seen dropping the suitcase and heading towards the ticket counter," ACP of the Government Railway Police said.

228.title: Ayushmann to join Dinesh Vijan-Amar Kaushik's horror universe
228.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana will be joining producer Dinesh Vijan and director Amar Kaushik's horror universe. Confirming the news, Ayushmann said, "It (the project) is very interesting and intriguing. It is very new for the Indian audience. So, let's see when it happens." The film is reportedly titled 'Vampire' with Samantha Ruth Prabhu as the female lead.

229.title: Only teams with big talent pools can have format-specific players: Kane
229.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said that only teams with big talent pools can have different players for red-ball and white-ball cricket formats. "With the volume of cricket happening, that is definitely a challenge...for the players...[and] support staff...You are always trying to balance that out and make sure guys are fresh," Williamson said.

230.title: BJP will break all records in Gujarat Assembly polls: Amit Shah
230.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Union Minister Amit Shah exuded confidence in the win of the BJP by a thumping majority and claimed that the party will break all the records. "[BJP] will form the government…The leadership of PM Modi and CM Bhupendra Patel is giving pace to development work. Gujarat’s law and order situation has improved," said Shah.

231.title: UN probes Germany's allegations of surveillance by Egypt at COP27
231.article_body: The UN Department of Safety and Security (UNDSS) is investigating allegations that COP27 host Egypt was "monitoring" participants. This comes after Germany complained to the Egyptian government that monitoring had allegedly taken place at its pavilion. The head of the Egyptian delegation, Wael Aboulmagd, denied reports of monitoring, saying, "It seems ludicrous because that's an open event."

232.title: China factory output slowed in Oct, retail sales fell 1st time since May
232.article_body: China's industrial output rose by 5% in October from a year earlier, slowing from the 6.3% seen in September, official data showed on Tuesday, as COVID-19 restrictions weighed on factory activity. Retail sales fell for the first time since May when Shanghai was under a city-wide COVID-19 lockdown. Sales dropped by 0.5% compared with a 2.5% gain in September.

233.title: PM Modi receives warm welcome at Indian community event in Bali
233.article_body: PM Narendra Modi received a warm welcome as he attended an Indian community event in Bali on Tuesday. Indian community chanted slogans of "Modi, Modi" as he reached the venue. PM Modi said India and Indonesia are united through cultures and traditions. "If India has...Himalayas, Indonesia has Mount Agung and if India has Ganga, Indonesia has Tirta Gangga," he added.

234.title: When she complained of pain, hospital dropped her home: Chennai footballer's coach
234.article_body: The coach of 18-year-old footballer R Priya, who died after alleged botched surgery in Chennai, said when she started complaining of pain, the hospital dropped her home in an ambulance and left immediately. He added that the hospital operated on her even though they didn't have a specialist. "They should have sent her to the government hospital immediately," he said.

235.title: Binance to form crypto recovery industry fund: CEO after FTX collapse
235.article_body: Binance, world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, is "forming an industry recovery fund, to help projects who are otherwise strong, but in a liquidity crisis", announced CEO Changpeng Zhao. Stating they wanted to reduce further cascading negative effects of FTX, he welcomed other industry players who want to co-invest. "Crypto is not going away. We are still here. Let's rebuild," Zhao tweeted.

236.title: Congress releases list of star campaigners for Gujarat elections
236.article_body: The Congress party released its list of star campaigners for upcoming Gujarat elections today. The list has 40 names including that of party chief Mallikarjun Kharge, UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, party MP Rahul Gandhi, General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Ashok Gehlot, Bhupesh Baghel, Sachin Pilot, Jignesh Mevani and Kanhaiya Kumar are some of the other names mentioned in the list.

237.title: Navi Mumbai sub-inspector booked on charges of raping policewoman
237.article_body: Navi Mumbai Police have booked a sub-inspector for allegedly raping a woman police officer. The accused and the victim are in their early 30s and unmarried, police said, adding they met during police training a few years ago and were in a relationship. The woman alleged that the accused promised marriage only to maintain physical relations with her, police added.

238.title: Sensex rises 248 points to end at 61,872, its all-time high on closing basis
238.article_body: The BSE Sensex on Tuesday rose 248 points to 61,872, its highest ever on a closing basis while the Nifty50 index settled at 18,403, its third-highest close ever. ONGC, Bharti Airtel and Hero Motocorp were among the top gainers of Nifty50 while HDFC Life Insurance and ITC were among the top laggards. The rupee closed at 81.10 per US dollar.

239.title: A great loss to Telugu film industry: Rajinikanth on actor Krishna's death
239.article_body: Rajinikanth took to Twitter to mourn the demise of veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna. "The demise of Krishna garu is a great loss to...Telugu film industry...working with him in 3 films are memories I will always cherish," he wrote. Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi wrote, "This is sad beyond words. It is unbelievable that the superstar Krishna has left us."

240.title: Delhi Police arrests gang producing fake life-saving cancer drugs
240.article_body: An international racket involved in the manufacturing of fake life-saving cancer drugs was busted and seven people, including two engineers and a doctor, were arrested, said RS Yadav, Special CP (crime), Delhi Police. Fake medicines valued at ₹8 crore were recovered, Yadav said, adding that the racket was operational for the last three-four years.

241.title: HDFC to raise up to ₹5,500 crore via bonds on Thursday
241.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC Limited will raise up to ₹5,500 crore by issuing bonds on a private placement basis. The secured redeemable non-convertible debentures (NCDs) issue will have a base size of ₹4,000 crore with an option to retain an oversubscription of up to ₹1,500 crore. The bond issue will open on Thursday and close on the same day.

242.title: Aditya Chopra rejected 'Chak De!' title track 6-7 times: Sulaiman
242.article_body: Music composer Sulaiman Merchant said that he and Salim Merchant made 6-7 versions of the title track of 'Chak De! India', which were rejected by Aditya Chopra. He recalled that Salim was ready to quit the film after another rejection. However, Sulaiman said that when lyricist Jaideep Sahni worked on the song, it got approved by Aditya.

243.title: Bhupendra Patel will undoubtedly be CM when BJP gets majority in Guj: Shah
243.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said when BJP gets a majority in upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls, incumbent CM Bhupendra Patel will "undoubtedly" return to the post. Shah stated that BJP will increase both its vote share and the number of seats by a record margin. "The people of Gujarat have never accepted the concept of a third party," he added.

244.title: BJP MLA demands 'Love Jihad' probe into Shraddha Walkar murder case
244.article_body: Reacting to the gruesome murder of Shraddha Walkar, BJP MLA Ram Kadam said that he will write a letter to the Delhi Police asking them to probe the matter from a possible "Love Jihad" angle. Ram Kadam and his supporters staged a protest in Mumbai against Walkar’s live-in partner. The accused killed Walkar in Delhi on May 18 this year.

245.title: President Murmu pays tribute to tribal icon Birsa Munda in Jharkhand
245.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday arrived in Jharkhand and paid tribute to tribal icon Birsa Munda in Ulihatu on his birth anniversary. Birsa Munda's birth anniversary is celebrated as 'Janjatiya Gaurav Divas'. "Visiting...places associated with his birth and work is like a pilgrimage for me," the President tweeted. She also extended wishes to people of Jharkhand on State Foundation Day.

246.title: Mumbai man who wanted to clear dues of ₹450 with cab company loses ₹1 lakh
246.article_body: A 42-year-old Mumbai resident, who wanted to clear his payment of ₹450 for a ride taken through a cab company, lost ₹1 lakh to a cyber fraudster. It happened after the victim found a fake customer care number on the internet. The fraudster, on the pretext of helping the victim, urged him to download an application and cheated him.

247.title: US tourist goes missing while hiking in Himachal Pradesh
247.article_body: A US tourist on a meditational retreat has gone missing while hiking in Dharamshala in Himachal Pradesh. Kangra SP Dr Kushal Chand Sharma said he informed the owner of the camp, where he was staying, on November 8 that he lost his way. "We have also deployed a dog squad and drone cameras to trace him," Sharma added.

248.title: Russian firm's code was used in US Army, CDC apps: Report
248.article_body: Thousands of apps on Apple and Google's online stores contain computer code developed by a Russian technology firm, Pushwoosh, that presents itself as a US-based company, Reuters has found. The US CDC said it removed Pushwoosh's code from seven public-facing apps after learning about the company's origin. The US Army said it removed an app containing Pushwoosh code in March.

249.title: Producer had unleashed his dog on me for fun during party, says Ranveer
249.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh revealed that a producer, whom he didn't name, had once unleashed his dog on him for fun during a private party. Ranveer added the producer is no more. He stated the producer had invited him to the party for a meeting. "It was that period that makes me value the opportunities I have now," he added.

250.title: We haven't made many good films in last year: Rao on Bollywood's performance
250.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, opening up about the performance of Bollywood movies, said, "We keep saying that Hindi cinema isn't doing well, but we've not made...many good films in the last year." "So, there's no point in wondering kyu nahi chal rahi hai (why is it not working). I think we need to push the envelope," he added.

251.title: Elephant falls into well in Andhra Pradesh, rescued with JCB's help
251.article_body: An elephant was rescued after it fell into a well in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor on Monday night. A video that has surfaced online shows a JCB machine demolishing a portion of the well's wall to make a slope. In the video, the elephant can be seen anxiously moving around inside the well and trying to climb up the wall.

252.title: US decision to probe Akleh's death is mistake, we won't cooperate: Israel
252.article_body: Israel has called the US investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh "a mistake", adding that the country will not cooperate with the probe. "We stand by the IDF's (Israel Defence Forces) soldiers...will not cooperate with an external investigation," Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz said. Akleh was killed while reporting at a refugee camp in Jenin.

253.title: India's trade deficit widens to $26.91 billion in October
253.article_body: India's October merchandise trade deficit widened to $26.91 billion from $25.71 billion in September, according to export and import data released by the government on Tuesday. The data showed that India's merchandise exports fell to $29.78 billion from $35.45 billion in September. Merchandise imports declined to $56.69 billion from $61.16 billion in the same period, the data showed.

254.title: Chinese tech giant Tencent begins a new round of layoffs: Report
254.article_body: Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings has begun a new round of layoffs, Reuters reported on Tuesday. The layoffs are targeted at its video streaming, gaming and cloud units, the report added. In August, Bloomberg reported that Tencent's workforce was reduced for the first time in nearly a decade as it let go of nearly 5,500 workers.

255.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra above politics, not to garner votes: Cong's Jairam
255.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said Bharat Jodo Yatra is not connected with any vote bank. "Its aims are above politics...it's not to garner votes," Ramesh added. "This yatra is promoting door-to-door contact which we had forgotten. We had forgotten as we were in power but we're remembering it with this yatra now," he stated.

256.title: Fire in footwear basement in Mumbai; no injuries reported
256.article_body: A fire erupted in a basement at the Shivashish Complex in the Chembur area of Mumbai on Monday. According to the Mumbai Fire Brigade, the fire broke out at 10:45 pm in the basement that was used for storage purposes by a shoe company. However, no injuries have been reported yet and the cause of the fire is still unknown.

257.title: Pune man posts threatening video of sickle on social media; arrested
257.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested in Pune on Sunday for allegedly posting a threatening video of a sickle on social media. The accused, Shubham Abhiman Jadhav, is a resident of the Thergaon area of Pimpri-Chinchwad. Jadhav's video went viral online, creating fear among the area's residents. He has been booked for possession of arms, police said.

258.title: Residents complain of heavy dust pollution in Mumbai's Mulund
258.article_body: Residents of Swapna Nagari in Mumbai's Mulund have complained of heavy dust pollution in the area, which they claim is the result of the ongoing construction work and a ready-mix concrete plant right next to their buildings. "The pollution has caused constant breathing and coughing problems," a resident said. They said they've also approached BMC regarding the issue.

259.title: Ton of flaws: Twitter employee on graph shared by Musk on Twitter's popularity
259.article_body: A Twitter employee who's on the Data Science team at Twitter called out Twitter's new owner Elon Musk after he shared a graph showing the platform's increased daily active users after his takeover. "Recent trend is promising," Musk tweeted. However, the Twitter employee tweeted, "I can say with certainty this graph has a ton of flaws in its calculation."

260.title: Delhi Police to seek Aftab's profile details from Bumble dating app
260.article_body: The Delhi Police is likely to write to the 'Bumble' dating app to seek Aftab Poonawala's profile details to find out about the women who visited him. Aftab, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, met her on Bumble. Delhi Police have already recovered 12 suspected body parts disposed of by Aftab.

261.title: School teacher arrested over FB posts against Karnataka minister
261.article_body: A school teacher has been arrested on charges of provocation and incitement to violence over social media posts against Karnataka Water Resources Minister Govind Karjol. The teacher allegedly asked about the absence of the BJP leader from his constituency in Mudhol on Facebook. Karjol is a five-time MLA from Mudhol in Bagalkot and a former deputy chief minister.

262.title: World population hits 8 billion, India to surpass China as most populated nation in 2023
262.article_body: The global human population crossed 8 billion on Tuesday, according to the UN. Meanwhile, India is projected to surpass China as the world’s most populous country in 2023. Amid falling growth rates, global population is projected to peak around 10.4 billion in the 2080s, the UN stated. The population has doubled from 4 billion in a span of 48 years.

263.title: India biggest contributor in reaching 8-bn world population mark, added 177 mn people
263.article_body: India was the biggest contributor to the world population's growth from 7 billion to 8 billion, the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) said. Notably, India's population will surpass China's in 2023. India added 177 million people while China, the second largest contributor to the 8 billion people milestone, added 73 million people to the world.

264.title: India didn't win T20 WC 2022 semis as their bowling had an off day: Uthappa
264.article_body: Reflecting on India's 10-wicket loss in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, Robin Uthappa said the only reason they didn't win was because their bowling had an off day against England. "It was a timid kind of effort with bat and ball," he added. Uthappa further said that India were successful until the semi-final because they bowled so well.

265.title: Three encounters in Noida within six hours; four arrested
265.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have arrested four men, including a Ghaziabad history-sheeter, after three encounters in Noida in the span of six hours from Monday night to early hours of Tuesday. The first encounter took place in Noida Sector 98 with a robber. The second encounter took place in Jarcha jurisdiction and the third encounter in Sector 15A.

266.title: Man accused of stealing trade secrets, sending them to China arrested: Canada
266.article_body: An employee of a public utility firm in Canada, Hydro-Quebec, has been arrested and charged with espionage for allegedly trying to steal trade secrets and sending them to China. Yuesheng Wang, 35, is also accused of using a computer without authorisation and deception to gain trade secrets. According to the police, the firm dealt with battery-related materials.

267.title: Sai Silks gets SEBI's nod to float ₹1,200 crore IPO
267.article_body: Sai Silks (Kalamandir) Limited has received SEBI's approval to raise ₹1,200 crore through an IPO. The IPO consists of fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹600 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to 1,80,48,440 equity shares by promoters and promoter group entities. The company plans to use the proceeds to set up new stores and two warehouses and pay debts.

268.title: 2 timer-fitted IEDs found near police post in Jammu, destroyed
268.article_body: Two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) with timers fitted to them were found near a police post in Jammu on Monday, officials said. The district SSP said, "We can't rule out the possibility of [a] Pakistani drone having dropped the consignment." The IEDs, which were hidden inside a black backpack, were destroyed in a controlled explosion a day later.

269.title: Kotak Investment Advisors raises $500 mn for $1 bn real estate fund
269.article_body: Kotak Investment Advisors Ltd (KIAL) announced it has received a $500 million investment for its $1 billion real estate fund from a unit of the UAE-based Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA). KIAL, the asset management division of the Kotak Mahindra Group, said it has so far raised, managed or advised over $3.3 billion under its real estate fund series.

270.title: Jharkhand Police rescue abducted 16-year-old girl; accused arrested
270.article_body: The Jharkhand Police rescued a 16-year-old girl and arrested the accused, who had abducted the minor and taken her to Bengaluru. According to the girl's parents, the accused arrived on two motorcycles, barged into their house and took the girl forcefully with them. Reports suggest that the abduction was carried out in order to convert the girl's religion.

271.title: Class 10 B'luru girl ends life after being caught cheating in class test
271.article_body: A Class 10 student died by suicide at her home in Bengaluru on Sunday. The incident took place days after school teachers allegedly scolded Amrutha after catching her copying from a chit during a class test. The minor girl left behind a suicide note. Her parents and friends staged a protest at Mariam Nilaya School with her body on Monday.

272.title: Actor Naga Shaurya faints on sets of his film after cutting off water from his diet: Reports
272.article_body: Tollywood actor Naga Shaurya fainted on the sets of his upcoming film on Monday due to dehydration and exhaustion, said reports. The actor had been cutting off water from his diet for four days to show his ripped body in a fight scene, reports added. "His temperature spiked and he had fainted...but he's okay now," the report quoted a source.

273.title: RSS-linked magazine accuses Amazon of funding religious conversions in India
273.article_body: The RSS-linked magazine "Organiser" has alleged that Amazon is sponsoring religious conversions in the country's northeast region and has also accused the company of getting involved in money laundering. "The American Baptist Mission is running a front in India known as the All India Mission. [It] has openly claimed...that they have converted 25,000 people to Christianity," the magazine said.

274.title: Can't believe such crime happened in neighbourhood: Shraddha's neighbour
274.article_body: Kusum Lata, a woman living in the same area as Shraddha Walkar and Aftab Poonawalla, said, "Nobody heard anything. It's just unbelievable." Her son said police asked for his help to bring down the fridge. "I was shocked and could not believe my ears when one of the journalists told me about the crime," another neighbour said.

275.title: Maybe, maybe not: Shubman Gill on whether he is dating Sara Ali Khan
275.article_body: During a recent Punjabi talk show, cricketer Shubman Gill was asked whether he is dating actress Sara Ali Khan. "Maybe, maybe not," the batter responded. Earlier in August, a video had gone viral on social media showing the duo at a restaurant together. Shubman was rumoured to be dating Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara Tendulkar earlier.

276.title: Get out of Ukraine: UK PM Rishi Sunak to Russia at G20 summit
276.article_body: Telling Russia to "get out of Ukraine" during the G20 summit in Bali, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, "It is notable that Putin didn't feel able to join us here. Maybe if he had, we could get on with sorting things out." The summit is being attended by Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.

277.title: Why was contract given to Ajanta without any tenders?: Gujarat HC on Morbi bridge collapse
277.article_body: Gujarat High Court on Tuesday questioned the manner in which contract for renovation of the Morbi bridge, which collapsed killing 135 people, was granted to the Ajanta Manufacturing Private Limited of the Oreva Group. The court noted, "The agreement signed between Morbi civic body and a private contractor is just 1.5 pages. Why contract was granted without inviting any tender?"

278.title: Uday Kotak's son not in race to lead Kotak Mahindra Bank: Firm's whole-time director
278.article_body: Billionaire Uday Kotak's son, Jay, isn’t in the running to lead Kotak Mahindra Bank, said KVS Manian, the firm's Whole-Time Director, during an interview. He added, "Jay is still young. He will have to work his way up on merit." Kotak has been the bank's CEO for over 18 years now and his current tenure will end in December 2023.

279.title: BJP MP threatens to demolish Mysuru bus stand with dome-like structures
279.article_body: BJP MP Pratap Simha on Monday threatened to demolish a bus stand in Karnataka's Mysuru which has dome-like structures on it. "I've seen pictures on social media of a bus stop with domes...It's a masjid," he said. He added that he has told engineers to demolish the structure and if they don't, he will take a JCB and demolish it.

280.title: My private pics were leaked by my ex-fiancé: Pakistani actress Rida Isfahani
280.article_body: While speaking about her 2016 MMS scandal, Pakistani actress Rida Isfahani has revealed that her ex-fiancé leaked her private pictures. "My trust was broken by my fiancé. I had convinced my parents for him, and my mindset was conservative so I wanted to be with only one person. Three years after our engagement, he leaked my pictures," she said.

281.title: My father used to think I'm wasting my aptitude in Bollywood: Radhika
281.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said that her father wasn't supportive of her Bollywood career and used to think that she's "wasting" her aptitude. "But he's very excited about me trying to write or...make things," she shared. Radhika added that her mother wanted to be an actress and she has "really backed" her Bollywood dreams.

282.title: Parts of Bengaluru to witness power cuts till Thursday
282.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from Tuesday to Thursday this week as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM)  will be undertaking some periodical repair and maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. Some of the areas which will remain affected today are - feeder areas of Davanagere, Court Road and Mahila Complex.

283.title: Sandals worn by Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs sold for ₹1.78 crore
283.article_body: A pair of Birkenstock sandals worn by late Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs were sold for $218,750 (around ₹1.78 crore) at an auction in the US. The "well-used" brown suede sandals dating to the mid-1970s set a record for the highest price ever paid for a pair of sandals. The sandals' cork and jute footbed retain the imprint of Jobs' feet.

284.title: Which states have highest active COVID cases as India sees lowest daily cases in 2.5 yrs?
284.article_body: Kerala has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases as India reported lowest daily cases in 2.5 years on Tuesday. Kerala is followed by Karnataka (1764), Maharashtra (962), Tamil Nadu (674) and Gujarat (343). India reported 474 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to latest government data.

285.title: Consumer food brand Yu raises ₹20 crore in Series A funding
285.article_body: Consumer food brand Yu raised ₹20 crore in a Series A funding in a mix of equity and venture debt, in a round led by investor Ashish Kacholia. Existing investors Manish Choksi and Varun Vakil of the Asian Paints Promoter Group and DPIIT's Startup India Seed Fund Scheme, which approved Yu under its ₹945-crore programme, also participated in the round.

286.title: G20 considers resolution with most members condemning war in Ukraine
286.article_body: G20 leaders considered a draft resolution in which most members strongly condemned the Russian war of Ukraine and stressed that the war was exacerbating fragilities in the global economy. The 16-page draft declaration mentioned that "recognising that the G20 is not the forum to resolve security issues, we acknowledge that security issues can have significant consequences for the global economy".

287.title: Hrithik Roshan starts 'Fighter' shoot, shares pic with director Siddharth
287.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan has begun the shooting of his upcoming film 'Fighter', which stars him along with Deepika Padukone. On Monday, the makers shared a picture of Hrithik and director Siddharth Anand on Instagram with "And it begins" as its caption. The actor is reportedly shooting for the film in Assam. Deepika and Anil Kapoor will reportedly join him soon.

288.title: UK PM extends support to Ukraine at G20, urges Putin to 'end barbaric war'
288.article_body: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak extended his support to Ukraine at the G20 summit and called upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to "end this barbaric war". Sunak called the Russian invasion of Ukraine "illegal". Last week, Britain said it would soon complete the delivery of 1,000 additional surface-to-air missiles to the Ukraine's armed forces.

289.title: The amount that I torture myself is next level: Musk to leaders wanting to be like him
289.article_body: Responding to a query about what business leaders should do to become like him, Elon Musk said, "Be careful about what you wish for...The amount that I torture myself is next level, frankly." Speaking about his increased workload after Twitter's acquisition, Musk said that while he's working "morning to night, seven days a week", it isn't something that he recommended.

290.title: Supporters of Shinde & Thackeray clash in Maha, video surfaces
290.article_body: A video has surfaced which shows Maharashtra Police resorting to lathi-charge after supporters of state CM Eknath Shinde and former CM Uddhav Thackeray clashed with each other in Thane. Shinde's supporters were seen shouting slogans like, "Eknath Shinde angar hai, baki sab bhangar hai." Both groups have levelled allegations against one another and FIRs have been filed against both.

291.title: Kieron Pollard announces retirement from IPL, becomes MI's batting coach
291.article_body: All-rounder Kieron Pollard has announced his retirement from IPL after playing for MI for 13 seasons. "It hasn't been...easiest decision...as I intend to keep playing for a few more years...but following discussions with MI I've decided to call time on my IPL career," he said. He further stated he has agreed to take up the role of MI's batting coach.

292.title: 8 months after farmer was killed, Pune police arrest key accused from Guj
292.article_body: Over eight months after a 38-year-old farmer was hacked to death in Pune's Junnar taluka, Pune Rural Police have arrested a key accused in the case from Gujarat. The accused changed his identity and looks. Rohidas Baburao Pable was killed in March, allegedly by five persons who attacked him with sharp swords and sickles in front of his family members.

293.title: BMC to float fresh tenders by November end to concretise Mumbai roads
293.article_body: The BMC has confirmed that it will float fresh tenders for concretising roads of Mumbai by the end of November. "New tenders will be floated...at an approximately 20% higher cost, as there has been an exponential rise in the price of raw material, including cement and steel over the last three years," said a senior official.

294.title: Acting smart: Gujarat HC to Morbi civic body after it doesn't show up at hearing
294.article_body: The Gujarat High Court on Tuesday said that Morbi civic body is "acting smart" after it failed to appear before it at the bridge collapse hearing despite being served a notice. In October, over 130 people were killed after the suspension bridge collapsed in the city. The court had taken suo motu cognisance of the bridge collapse earlier this month.

295.title: BJP fields ex-MP Raghuraj Shakya against Dimple Yadav in Mainpuri by-poll
295.article_body: BJP on Tuesday named Raghuraj Singh Shakya, a former MP, as its candidate for the Lok Sabha by-poll in the Mainpuri seat of Uttar Pradesh against Samajwadi Party's Dimple Yadav. The election was necessitated after SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav's death in October. Shakya was once close to Shivpal Yadav but quit the Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) to join BJP.

296.title: BEST to run special bus services amid train traffic block on Nov 19-20
296.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport ( BEST) will run special bus services during the 27-hour train traffic block by Central Railway between CSMT and Masjid station in Mumbai. BEST will run 12 buses starting from 10.30 pm on Saturday (November 19) to 6.30 am on Sunday (November 20). It will run 35 additional buses on Sunday till 10 pm.

297.title: He'll live on through his work & lives he influenced: Krishna's family
297.article_body: Late legendary actor Krishna's family shared a statement expressing their "deepest grief" on the actor's death. "He was a superstar in so many ways beyond the movie screen...He'll live on through his work, through us, and many lives he influenced," the statement read. Krishna passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest. Pawan Kalyan, Chiranjeevi, Rajinikanth and others mourned Krishna's death.

298.title: World population crosses 8 billion
298.article_body: The global human population crossed 8 billion on Tuesday, according to the United Nations (UN). Amid falling growth rates, global population is projected to peak around 10.4 billion in the 2080s, the UN stated. Notably, the human population has doubled from 4 billion in a span of 48 years.

299.title: SoftBank to reduce stakes in Paytm, Policybazaar, Delhivery gradually: Report
299.article_body: Japanese venture investor SoftBank, whose holdings in Paytm, Policybazaar and Delhivery are currently worth $1.8 billion, will reportedly reduce its stake gradually over the next two years. SoftBank had cumulatively invested around $2.2 billion in these three companies and offloaded shares worth $560 million at their IPOs. This means it stands to gain around $160 million from these bets.

300.title: Some people don't work with me, are worried it may not be approved: Prakash Raj
300.article_body: Actor Prakash Raj said that some people do not want to work with him. "Not because they have been told not to...but they are worried 'they' may not approve. I am strong and rich enough to lose all that. I always feel my fear will be somebody's power," he added, while speaking about his political views impacting his work relationships.

301.title: Power utility CESC board approves proposal to raise ₹300 cr via NCDs
301.article_body: Power utility CESC said its board has approved a proposal to raise ₹300 crore through the issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs). The board approved the issue of 3,000 secured, unlisted, redeemable, rated NCDs having a face value of ₹10 lakh/each for cash at par aggregating to ₹300 crore, on a private placement basis, the company said in a BSE filing.

302.title: Twitter to remove device labels from tweets, Musk says 'No one knows why we did that'
302.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk said that the social media platform will stop adding labels that identify what kind of device has been used for tweeting. He wrote, "And we'll finally stop adding what device a tweet was written on (waste of screen space & compute) below every tweet. Literally, no one even knows why we did that."

303.title: 7 persons arrested for armed robbery worth ₹28 lakh in Pune
303.article_body: Seven persons were arrested by Pune City Police in connection with the daylight armed robbery of about ₹28 lakh at the office of an 'angadia', a private courier service system, in Market Yard area. On Saturday, robbers armed with weapons and a pistol barged into the office of PM Courier. One of them opened fire and they looted the cash.

304.title: Ukrainian President urges G20 nations to adopt its peace plan to end war
304.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has proposed a peace plan and urged the countries meeting at the G20 summit to step up their leadership and stop the Russian war in Ukraine. Zelenskyy reiterated that Russia must withdraw all its troops from Ukraine. He called for the release of all Ukrainian prisoners and also urged for restoration of "radiation safety".

305.title: ₹3 hike in milk, curd prices in Karnataka put on hold after CM's intervention
305.article_body: Karnataka Milk Federation's decision to hike the prices of milk and curd across the state has been put on hold after CM Basavaraj Bommai intervened. The decision, which increased milk and curd prices by ₹3, was supposed to come into effect today. Bommai said that a meeting will be held on November 20 to take a decision on price revision.

306.title: Ludhiana Police book man for stalking, harassing 42-year-old woman
306.article_body: The Ludhiana Police booked a man for stalking and harassing a 42-year-old woman. The accused has been identified as Happy Verma of Sukhdev Nagar, Jamalpur. The woman claimed that the accused used to stalk her and also created a fake account using her name on Instagram to post her pictures. The police launched a manhunt to arrest the accused.

307.title: 'Mother Heroine' award given to women with over 10 kids in Russia
307.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin handed out 'Mother Heroine' awards, months after reviving the Soviet-era title. As per the official decree reviving the award, the title is awarded to "a mother who is a citizen of the Russian Federation, who has given birth to and brought up ten or more children". Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov's wife is among the recipients.

308.title: District judges are not subordinates, need to change mindset: CJI
308.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud on Monday said judicial officers of the districts are not subordinate judges and underlined the need to change the mindset towards district judiciary. "I think we've fostered a culture of subordination...I make a conscious effort not to call our district judges as subordinate judges because they are not subordinates, they belong to the district judiciary," he added.

309.title: ICC names 5 best matches of T20 World Cup 2022
309.article_body: The ICC has named five best matches of the recently-concluded T20 World Cup 2022. It has included three matches involving India. The list features Netherlands' win over South Africa, with ICC calling it "an upset of great magnitude". India's last-ball win over Pakistan, Zimbabwe's win over Pakistan, and England and South Africa's victories against India have been included.

310.title: Cambodian PM Hun Sen tests COVID +ve at G20 after meeting world leaders at ASEAN summit
310.article_body: Cambodian PM Hun Sen has tested COVID-19 positive at the G20 summit in Indonesia, days after meeting world leaders including US President Joe Biden and India's Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar at ASEAN summit. He cancelled all his G20 meetings and is returning to Cambodia. He said it was "lucky" he arrived late in Bali and missed a dinner with other leaders.

311.title: Which countries have highest number of int'l students in US as India comes 2nd?
311.article_body: China and India represent the majority (52%) of all international students in the United States. China remains the top sending country in 2021/22, with 290,086 students. India, the second top-sending country, sent 199,182 international students in 2021/22, an increase of 19% year-over-year. South Korea is third, followed by Canada, Vietnam, Taiwan, Saudi Arabia, Brazil, Mexico and Nigeria.

312.title: Google to pay $391.5 million in US location-tracking settlement
312.article_body: Alphabet's Google has agreed to a $391.5-million settlement with 40 US states over its location-tracking practices and misleading consumers since at least 2014. The state attorneys opened an investigation in 2018 after a report of Google recording location data even when users instruct it not to. This was in violation of state consumer protection laws.

313.title: T'gana govt auctions open plots, flats in Hyd, other districts
313.article_body: The Telangana government is conducting auctions of open plots and flats in Hyderabad and other districts to raise ₹2,000 crore. Over 450 open plots under Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) limits and 2,400 plots in other seven districts of the state will be available for the auction which started on November 14 and will continue till November 23.

314.title: Hope the monster gets harshest punishment: Swara on Shraddha murder case
314.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said that the Shraddha murder case is "horrifying, gruesome and tragic". "Hope police speedily conclude their investigation and hope this monster gets the harshest punishment he thoroughly deserves," she tweeted about Aftab Poonawala, who is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walker. She added that her heart goes out to the victim.

315.title: Parents struggled to pay rents, couldn't even buy me toy: Rashmika
315.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna recalled that there was a time when her parents struggled to pay their house rent. The actress said that in her heart, she is still "that girl who could not even buy a toy". Stating that she respects the money she has earned, Rashmika added, "My childhood memories don't let me take my success lightly."

316.title: King Charles urges UK Parliament to allow his siblings to act in his place
316.article_body: King Charles has asked the British Parliament to amend the law to allow his siblings, Princess Anne and Prince Edward, to act on his behalf in his absence. In a statement read out in the House of Lords on his behalf, King Charles asked for the number of Counsellors of State to be increased to include his siblings.

317.title: Gurugram DC writes to Centre on compensation for NBCC Green View residents
317.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner (DC) Nishant Kumar Yadav has written to the central government demanding its intervention to get NBCC to announce a suitable compensation for residents of NBCC Green View condominium located in Sector 37-D. The condominium was deemed unfit for living during a structural audit, after which Yadav had directed the residents to vacate the flats by March 1.

318.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Birsa Munda, calls him 'great son of India'
318.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Birsa Munda on his birth anniversary and recalled his contribution in giving a sharp edge to the freedom movement. Calling him a "great son of the country", the PM said, "He was not only the hero of our political independence, but he was also the conductor of our spiritual and cultural energy."

319.title: Family of footballer Priya R protests as she dies in botched knee surgery
319.article_body: Family members of an 18-year-old footballer, Priya R, who allegedly died after knee surgery due to medical negligence, held a protest on Tuesday, demanding immediate action from police in the matter. The protest was held as Priya's body was being carried out from the mortuary after a post-mortem. She underwent surgery for a ligament tear.

320.title: Fusion Micro Finance's shares list at 2.3% discount at ₹359
320.article_body: Non-banking finance company (NBFC) Fusion Micro Finance Limited made its stock market debut at a 2.3% discount against its issue price of ₹368/piece on Tuesday. The stock's listing price on the NSE was ₹359.50. The issue, which hit the market during November 2-4, was subscribed 2.95 times. At 11:05 am, the stock was trading at ₹343 per share on BSE.

321.title: 2 men consuming liquor in car assault sales executive in Noida
321.article_body: A sales executive was allegedly assaulted by two men who were consuming liquor in a car in a Greater Noida housing society on Sunday. The victim claimed they parked their car in the middle of the road and he asked them to move. "As I went past them, they got irked and picked up an argument with me," he added.

322.title: Told Shraddha's father her phone was switched off since June: Friend
322.article_body: Lakshman Nadar, a friend of Shraddha Walkar, informed her father that her phone was switched off since June, after which her father filed a missing complaint with police. Nadar last spoke to her in May. "I got worried when Shraddha didn't respond to my messages or returned my calls when I tried to reach her in July and...August," he said.

323.title: India reports 474 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since April 2020
323.article_body: India reported 474 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since April 2020. The number of active cases went down to 7,918 from the earlier 9,468, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,533, according to the ministry.

324.title: Govt releases pic of PM Modi meeting Rishi Sunak for 1st time after he became UK PM
324.article_body: The Prime Minister's Office has released a picture of PM Narendra Modi meeting Rishi Sunak for the first time after the latter became the UK's Prime Minister. "Prime Ministers [Narendra Modi] and [Rishi Sunak] in conversation during the first day of the [G20] Summit in Bali," the PMO wrote on Twitter. PM Modi also met US President Joe Biden.

325.title: BJP is breaking nation, we are unifying it: Mallikarjun Kharge
325.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised the BJP and said that the ruling party is breaking the nation, whereas the Congress is unifying it. "Let us ask you what you have done for the nation and tell us what we haven’t done...There are 30 lakh vacancies in this country and you are giving appointment orders to only 75,000 people," said Kharge.

326.title: Woman, 3 others try to cut off man's private parts in Pune; booked
326.article_body: A woman and her three accomplices were booked after they allegedly tried to cut off a man's private parts in Pune, police officials said. One of the woman's accomplices used her number to message the man to meet her near a temple and when he reached the spot, he was kidnapped, according to the man's complaint. The woman was arrested.

327.title: Man jumps in front of train with 2-yr-old son, both die in Gurugram
327.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped in front of a train along with his two-year-old son near a railway crossing in Gurugram, railway police said on Monday. The man's son also died in the incident. An inquiry revealed that the man had done so after he discovered that his wife had eloped with another man, police said.

328.title: US-based genomics company Illumina to fire at least 500 employees
328.article_body: US-based genomics company Illumina, which makes machines to sequence DNA, has announced that it will fire at least 500 employees, 5% of its workforce, due to current macroeconomic environment. The firm said it is "proactively realigning core Illumina operating expenses to reflect the current macroeconomic environment." Earlier this month, Illumina reported $1.11 billion in core revenues for Q3.

329.title: Aftab used mini saw to chop live-in partner Shraddha's body parts: Report
329.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who has been arrested for the killing of his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi, reportedly used a mini saw to chop off her body parts, reported ANI citing police sources on Tuesday. The news agency reported that only one weapon was used to chop Shraddha's body parts and the mini saw is yet to be recovered.

330.title: 8 Hyd college students arrested over youth's assault after video goes viral
330.article_body: Eight students of a Hyderabad-based institute have been arrested for allegedly assaulting an undergraduate student inside a hostel room, a video of which had surfaced earlier. While five were arrested earlier, three were arrested on Monday, police said. Police added that nine members of the school's administration have also been booked for their alleged inaction in responding to the incident.

331.title: Don't underestimate chocolates, diamonds not needed: Ranveer on anniversary
331.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that one should not underestimate the power of flowers and chocolates. While putting up a story on his wedding anniversary with wife-actress Deepika Padukone, he wrote, "Diamonds not needed...take notes and thank me later gentlemen." He revealed that he surprised Deepika during work at her office on their anniversary.

332.title: Cockroach found in AIIMS' meal for 4-yr-old boy who had stomach surgery; pic surfaces
332.article_body: The AIIMS Delhi administration reportedly initiated an inquiry into a complaint that a cockroach was found in the food served to a four-year-old patient admitted there. A Twitter user posted details about the incident with a picture of the insect, stating that the hospital served "Cockroach Daal" to the boy as first meal post major stomach surgery.

333.title: Bird stuck in kite string saved as Gurugram kids spot it hanging upside down
333.article_body: Teams of the fire brigade and National Highway Authority of India (NHAI) rescued a brown-headed barbet after children in the area saw it hanging upside down on a tree in Gurugram. The bird was entangled in a kite string and almost choked to death, reports said. The children saw the bird trying to free itself.

334.title: Twitter worker posts pic of locked-out laptop after he's fired by Musk over disagreement
334.article_body: Eric Frohnhoefer, an engineer who was fired from Twitter after engaging in a public disagreement with Elon Musk, shared a photo of his locked-out laptop hours after his dismissal. "Guess it is official now," wrote Eric while sharing the photo. He also alleged that he received no formal communication about his termination and said, "They're all a bunch of cowards."

335.title: Biden walks over to PM Modi, hugs him at G20 Summit in Bali; video viral
335.article_body: At the start of the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali, US President Joe Biden walked over to PM Narendra Modi to greet him. A video, which is being widely circulated online, shows the two leaders hugging before exchanging a few words. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and NSA Ajit Doval were also present with PM Modi.

336.title: US orders Air India to pay $121.5 mn as passenger refunds & $1.4 mn as penalty
336.article_body: The US has ordered Air India and five other airlines to pay over $600 million in refunds. Air India has been ordered to pay $121.5 million as refunds and $1.4 million as penalty for delays in providing refunds to passengers due to changes or cancellations in flights. Frontier, TAP Air Portugal, Aeromexico, EI AI, and Avianca were the other airlines.

337.title: US firm Maven Clinic raises $90 mn in round led by General Catalyst
337.article_body: US-based women and family healthcare startup Maven Clinic has secured $90 million in a Series E funding round led by General Catalyst. The funding round saw participation from CVS Health Ventures, La Famiglia and Intermountain Ventures. After the latest round, the company's total capital reached $300 million and valuation increased to $1.35 billion. Maven Clinic was founded by Kate Ryder.

338.title: Nehru taking Kashmir issue to international forum a 'monumental blunder': Puri
338.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri criticised former PM Jawaharlal Nehru over Kashmir, saying the decision of the country's first PM to take the issue to a multilateral forum was a "monumental blunder". "Why was the issue taken to international or multinational fora? My information has been that then Maharaja Hari Singh was happy to sign instrument of accession," Puri asked.

339.title: Vedanta may sell off ESL Steel Limited, exit steel business: Report
339.article_body: Vedanta is planning to sell off ESL Steel Limited (formerly known as Electrosteel Steels Limited) to deleverage the balance sheet which had a debt of $11.7 billion in March-end and exit the steel business, The Economic Times reported. Vedanta has reportedly approached ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel, Tata Steel, JSW and Jindal Steel and Power Limited for the same.

340.title: First international cruise ship arrives at Mumbai Port after 2-yr gap
340.article_body: The sailing season's first international cruise ship arrived at Mumbai Port on Sunday, after a gap of two-year due to COVID-19 pandemic. A Switzerland-based luxury liner MV Viking Mars reached the Mumbai Port with 834 passengers onboard. Before this sailing season ends in May 2023, around 30 international cruise ships are scheduled to visit Mumbai, officials said.

341.title: Will contest polls from Srinagar: Punjab MP on being 'denied entry' into J&K
341.article_body: Punjab MP Simranjit Singh Mann, who was "denied entry" into Jammu and Kashmir, has said that he will contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections from Srinagar. Simranjit had moved a court after he was stopped from entering Kathua last month. However, when Simranjit reached Kathua to appear before the court, he wasn't allowed to move out of the hotel.

342.title: Pakistan bans its official Oscar entry 'Joyland' over 'highly objectionable' material
342.article_body: Pakistan's official 2023 Oscars entry 'Joyland', which is based on transgender love story, has been banned by the country's authorities, citing "highly objectionable" and "repugnant" material. The makers of the film are criticising the ban and calling it "absolutely unconstitutional and illegal". The film was the first Pakistani film to be selected as an official entry at Cannes film festival.

343.title: 18-year-old footballer R Priya dies after botched surgery, amputation in Chennai
343.article_body: R Priya, an 18-year-old footballer who was studying physical education at Chennai's Queen Mary's College, died due to multi-organ failure following medical negligence by doctors at Government Peripheral Hospital, Periyar Nagar. She underwent surgery for ligament tear. She was moved to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, where her right leg had to be amputated due to initial botched surgery.

344.title: Must return to ceasefire & diplomacy in Ukraine: PM at G20 summit
344.article_body: While speaking at the G20 summit in Bali, PM Narendra Modi called for diplomacy in Ukraine. "I've repeatedly said that we have to find a way to return to path of ceasefire and diplomacy in Ukraine," he said. It's necessary to show concrete resolve to ensure peace in the world, he added. Ukraine was invaded by Russia earlier this year.

345.title: Aftab messaged Shraddha's friends on Instagram after murder, paid her credit card bills
345.article_body: According to investigators, after Aftab Poonawala killed his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi on May 18 this year, he logged into her Instagram account and messaged her friends to create the impression that she was still alive. He also paid her credit card bills so that the companies don't contact her Mumbai address, the investigators told the Indian Express.

346.title: Aftab killed Shraddha after she saw him messaging someone: Report
346.article_body: During interrogation, Aftab claimed that Shraddha saw him exchanging messages with someone on the phone, which led to the fatal fight. Earlier, police sources said that Aftab's Google search history revealed he had looked up ways to destroy evidence and clean bloodstains. He also bought incense sticks to mask the smell, sources added.

347.title: Been stalking Sanjay Leela Bhansali like a maniac: Janhvi Kapoor
347.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that Sanjay Leela Bhansali is one of her dream directors to work with. "I've been stalking him like a maniac," she admitted. Janhvi added she would also like to work with Karan Johar and Neeraj Ghaywan. Talking about Karan's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', Janhvi said it is going to be "the most fun" film.

348.title: Actor Krishna was critically ill with multiple organ failure: Hospital
348.article_body: A statement from Continental Hospitals, where legendary actor Krishna was admitted, read that he was critically ill with "multiorgan failure and severe hypoxic brain injury". Krishna, father of actor Mahesh Babu, passed away in Hyderabad after suffering from cardiac arrest. The actor, who featured in over 350 films in his career, was honoured with the Padma Bhushan in 2009.

349.title: You fool, people sleep at night: Akshay on media asking why he sleeps early
349.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that media people ask him why he sleeps so early. "You fool, people sleep at night," he said. "I don't understand. Media persons ask me why do you get up early. But morning is for waking up, right?" he added. He also spoke about people commenting on him doing multiple films a year.

350.title: Suspended BJP MLA criticises T'gana govt as bulletproof vehicle breaks down
350.article_body: Suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh allegedly got angry after his bulletproof vehicle broke down on Monday. He reportedly criticised the Telangana government for providing a vehicle which is in poor condition despite the fact that he faces threat from terrorists. He said that the vehicle had broken down four months ago and was sent back to him after repairs.

351.title: FastJobs.io raises funds from BookMyShow Co-founders, others
