351.article_body: Jobtech platform FastJobs.io has raised an undisclosed amount in a pre-seed round from angel investors led by Ashish Hemrajani, BookMyShow Founder and CEO, BookMyShow Co-founder Parikshit Dar, Haresh Chawla, the Founding CEO of Network18 and Partner, True North, along with other angel investors. FastJobs.io was co-founded by Yash Dandavate, Ashish Dogra and Neelu Virk in 2022.

352.title: Okhla Bird Sanctuary dry for over 20 days; migration of birds affected
352.article_body: Noida's Okhla Bird Sanctuary (OBS) has remained dry since the past 20 days, to facilitate canal repair work, and the lack of water seems to have impacted the arrival of winter migratory birds, said birders and park officials. The ongoing repair work is carried out every year but this year it was more extensive, the officials added.

353.title: Alameda CEO & Sam Bankman-Fried's rumoured ex-girlfriend under scrutiny after FTX collapse
353.article_body: The CEO of Alameda Research, Caroline Ellison, 28, is under scrutiny after the collapse of cryptocurrency exchange FTX. As per a report, former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried secretly transferred $10 billion of customer funds from FTX to Alameda. The two had reportedly also dated and she was among Bankman-Fried's nine roommates that operated FTX from a penthouse in the Bahamas.

354.title: Tribal leader files nomination as independent, to contest against son in Guj
354.article_body: The founder of the Bharatiya Tribal Party, Chhotubhai Vasava, on Monday filed his nomination as an independent from the Jhagadia Assembly seat in the Bharuch district of Gujarat. Notably, his son Maheshbhai Chhotubhai Vasava is BTP's official candidate. "Chhotu Vasava...said he'll continue to fight for rights of tribals...Nobody can snatch the Jhagadia seat from him," the founder's aide said.

355.title: Confident G20 leaders will convey message of peace from India: PM
355.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said he is confident that when G20 leaders will meet in India next year for the summit, they all will send a strong message of peace to the world. He called India the land of Buddha and Mahatma Gandhi. "Today world has greater expectations from G-20, the relevance of our group has become more significant," he added.

356.title: We want products 'made in India', not 'made in China': Rahul Gandhi
356.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of ignoring farmers' issues and said that the country wants 'made in India' products, not 'made in China'. Rahul Gandhi added, "The government is not providing [farmers] suitable rates for their produce. They have stopped exports…Rates of oil and gas have…sky-rocketed…Cameras, mobiles and clothes are imported from China."

357.title: School buses in Mumbai seek change in school timings due to heavy traffic
357.article_body: School bus operators in Mumbai are in talks with authorities seeking a change in the timings of some schools around Andheri. The closure of the Gokhale Road bridge has led to severe traffic woes in the city and drivers are not being able to manage multiple shifts and match the school timings, president of School Bus Owners' Association (SBOA) said.

358.title: Must celebrate International Year of Millets with enthusiasm next yr: PM at G20
358.article_body: While speaking at the G20 summit in Bali, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that a mutual agreement to keep the supply chain of both manure and food grains stable and assured should be made. "In India...we're...re-popularising nutritious...and...traditional foodgrains like millets...We all must celebrate International Year of Millets with...great enthusiasm next year," he added.

359.title: Refused 'Salaam Venky' for 3 days, it's parents' worst nightmare: Kajol
359.article_body: Actress Kajol shared that she initially refused 'Salaam Venky' for three days as she found it to be "every parent's worst nightmare". "It's a serious topic which scares us...the film is about the celebration of life," she said. Kajol added that after watching 'Phir Milenge', she decided that she wouldn't say no to Revathy if she ever offers a film.

360.title: Osho disciples to stage protest at Charity Commissioner's Mumbai office
360.article_body: Disciples of Osho from various places will stage a silent protest outside the Charity Commissioner's office in Mumbai's Worli today as it's expected to announce the re-bidding of Osho's Pune land. "Around 300 of us will be gathering outside the Charity Commissioner's office…Tuesday, the re-bidding will be opened...the earlier one was held improper on various grounds," said a disciple.

361.title: Pat Cummins pulls out of IPL 2023 due to packed international schedule
361.article_body: Australia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins has pulled out of IPL 2023, citing a "packed" international schedule. Calling it a difficult decision, Cummins, who was signed to KKR, tweeted, "The international schedule is packed with Tests and ODIs for the next 12 months, so will take some rest ahead of an Ashes series and World Cup."

362.title: Aftab brought woman home on date while Shraddha's body parts were hidden in fridge: Report
362.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who was arrested for killing his 27-year-old live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in Delhi in May 2022, allegedly brought another woman to his flat on a date while Shraddha's body parts were stuffed in a fridge, The Indian Express reported on Tuesday. "The other woman came to his house a couple of times in June-July," the report read.

363.title: No political pressure on police: Shinde on Awhad's molestation case
363.article_body: After NCP leader Jitendra Awhad was booked on charges of molestation after he allegedly pushed a female BJP leader, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the police will conduct a probe and take necessary actions. "There'll be transparency. There's no political pressure on...police," he added. "Police registered two false cases against me in 72 hours," Awhad had said earlier.

364.title: Comedian Jay Leno's face burned in car fire in Los Angeles
364.article_body: Comedian Jay Leno was taken to a medical centre after his face was burned in his Los Angeles garage when one of his cars caught fire. "I got some serious burns from a gasoline fire...Just need a week or two to get back on my feet," he said. He has been one of America's most-watched late night TV hosts.

365.title: 'I've right to make my decisions' were the last words to parents by Shraddha
365.article_body: As per the FIR filed by her father, while leaving her Mumbai home in 2019, Shraddha Walkar's last words to her parents were, "I'm 25-years-old and I have every right to make my own decisions. I want to be in a live-in relationship with Aftab Poonawala." "You may think I'm not your daughter from today," she reportedly told them.

366.title: Selligion Technologies raises ₹3 crore in seed funding round
366.article_body: Selligion Technologies raised ₹3 crore from Bounce Infinity CEO Vivekananda Hallekere, Jar App CEO Nishchay Ag and Xiaomi Global founding team member Alvin Tse, who participated in a seed round. Selligion has developed Praho, the world's first direct-to-consumer, hybrid cloud-based computer. The firm was founded by Naman Chakraborty, Yoshita Sengupta, Joby John and Puneet Raheja in 2020.

367.title: 5 of family drown after they jump into canal to save woman in Guj
367.article_body: Five members of a family drowned after they all jumped into the Narmada canal in a bid to save a woman in Gujarat's Mundra, Kutch West SP Saurabh Singh said. The SP added that the incident took place when the woman slipped into the canal while fetching water. The bodies of the deceased have been recovered, the SP further said.

368.title: Helping someone raise standard of living isn't 'revadi': Amit Shah
368.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said giving support to raise someone's standard of living or make infrastructure isn't "revadi". "Giving electricity isn't revadi, no bill is. Giving a house isn't revadi but keeping it tax-free is," Shah added. "We gave free ration amid pandemic because of lingering slowdown after COVID-19 affected the poor," he stated.

369.title: One night she asked me to take her out, said Aftab will kill her: Shraddha's friend
369.article_body: A friend of Shraddha Walker, the 26-year-old woman who was allegedly murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Ameen, has claimed that the couple used to fight a lot. He said that one night Shraddha sent him a WhatsApp message, requesting him to take her somewhere. "She said that if she lived with Aftab that night, he'd kill her," he added.

370.title: Had best excuse to not hit gym after baby, smashed each session: Ranbir's coach
370.article_body: Ranbir's coach Drew Neal said that the actor had the "best excuse" to not hit the gym after the birth of his daughter on November 6. However, Neal said that the actor did not skip a beat and smashed every single session. Neal posted a picture of himself with the actor from the gym on Instagram.

371.title: Some Twitter contract workers learnt they were fired after reading other's tweets
371.article_body: After mass layoffs of its full-time staff, Twitter has reportedly fired 4,400 contractual workers and as per reports, the affected staff were not given any formal notices about the same. "This tweet is how I found out," wrote an affected worker on a journalist's tweet about the job cuts. The journalist also shared a similar text message from another worker.

372.title: Daughters of India deserve justice: Cong's Jairam on Shraddha murder case
372.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh condemned the murder of 26-year-old Shraddha Walkar by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawalla in Delhi, saying she and "the daughters of India deserve justice". "The entire nation is shocked and angry at the brutality with which Aftab Poonawalla killed his live-in partner…No words can describe this trauma. This is a heinous crime," Ramesh added.

373.title: Bengaluru gets new police commissioners for traffic and crime
373.article_body: The Karnataka government did several transfers in the police department and also created a new post in traffic department. MA Saleem, a 1993-batch IPS officer, was appointed as Special Commissioner of Bengaluru Traffic Police. Among other major changes in the city, the government has appointed Deputy Commissioner (Crime) SD Sharanappa as the Joint Commissioner (Crime) in place of Raman Gupta.

374.title: Delhi's air quality improves from 'very poor' to 'poor'; AQI at 221
374.article_body: The air quality in Delhi improved on Tuesday, though it still remained in the 'poor' category. An AQI of 221 was recorded in Delhi while the AQI in Terminal 3 was 218. On Monday, the Delhi High Court commented that it cannot close its eyes to the fact that Delhi's air quality oscillates between 'very poor' and 'severe'.

375.title: Measles outbreaks in Govandi slums since January: Central team
375.article_body: The Centre-appointed three-member team, which was sent to Mumbai to check measles outbreak, found that Govandi slums had continuous waves of the disease since January. The team, which was in Mumbai for three days, found that 60% of the measles cases did not take vaccine and 40% did not take second dose which is given on 16th month since birth.

376.title: ₹2.85 cr pipeline sanctioned after Hyd kid's request on Children's Day
376.article_body: After a young boy from Hyderabad requested Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao for a drinking water pipeline in the city's Golden City Colony, a pipeline at a cost of ₹2.85 crore was sanctioned for the area. This was done after KTR responded to the video and asked Managing Director of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board to resolve issue.

377.title: Unmanned barricades still found in Delhi: HC to Delhi Police
377.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday observed that unmanned barricades are still found in the national capital and directed the Delhi Police to file a detailed report on the number of barricades that have been set up. The court also cited an incident wherein a sitting judge faced problems due to unmanned barricades while taking his mother to the hospital.

378.title: 93.5%* learners placed at top tech companies: Scaler
378.article_body: With the right learning environment and mentorship, learners can secure a spot at their dream tech company, said Scaler. It mentioned that learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there. Scaler's alumni are working at top companies such as Amazon, Microsoft, Delhivery, Udaan, Myntra, and more, it added.

379.title: Actor John Aniston passes away aged 89; daughter Jennifer Aniston shares post
379.article_body: John Aniston, the Emmy-winning star of the show Days of Our Lives and father of Jennifer Aniston, has died at age 89. "Sweet papa... John Anthony Aniston. You were one of the most beautiful humans I ever knew. I am so grateful that you went soaring into the heavens in peace...And on 11/11 no less," Jennifer wrote in her post.

380.title: Man Utd kind of didn't believe something was wrong: Ronaldo on daughter's illness
380.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo, in a recent interview, accused Manchester United hierarchy of "doubting" his words when he told them his newborn daughter was sick after the death of his newborn son. Ronaldo said, "They kind of didn't believe...something was wrong...which made me feel bad." He added, "I didn't go to...pre-season because of that. I wouldn't let my family suffer for...pre-season."

381.title: PM Modi, US President Biden interact during G20 Summit in Bali, PMO shares pic
381.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden were seen interacting in Indonesia's Bali as the G20 Summit kicked off on Tuesday. In a photo shared by the Prime Minister's Office, the two leaders were seen shaking hands and smiling. A video tweeted by ANI showed PM Modi interacting with Biden and greeting French President Emmanuel Macron.

382.title: I failed to see warning signs: FTX ex-CEO Bankman-Fried
382.article_body: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried in an interview with the NYT agreed he expanded his business too quickly and failed to see the warning signs for FTX. "Had I been a bit more concentrated on what I was doing, I would have been able to be more thorough," he added. However, he declined to discuss the prospect of prison time.

383.title: New Zealand announce squads for ODI and T20I series against India, Trent Boult dropped
383.article_body: New Zealand have announced their squads for the upcoming ODI and T20I series against India. Pacer Trent Boult, who gave up his central contract in August, has been dropped from both the squads. Opener Martin Guptill has also not been included. Tom Latham will keep wickets in the ODI series, while Devon Conway will keep wickets in the T20I series.

384.title: Bodies of 8 labourers recovered after Mizoram stone quarry collapse, search on for others
384.article_body: The bodies of eight Bihar labourers were recovered on Tuesday after they were reported trapped when a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram on Monday. Reports said that the search is still on for others. National Disaster Response Force said that the identification of the dead bodies would be done after post-mortem examination.

385.title: Veteran actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna dies after suffering cardiac arrest
385.article_body: Veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna who had suffered a cardiac arrest has passed away in Hyderabad. Doctors said that CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) was performed immediately and he was shifted to the ICU for treatment and observation. He had acted in 350 films and was one of the top actors of the time.

386.title: 21-year-old woman slips & falls into quarry, dies in Pune
386.article_body: A 21-year-old woman died after she slipped and fell into a quarry when she went out of her house to throw garbage in Pune. A father and his son, who're owners of the quarry, have been booked on charges of negligence following the incident, an inspector said. "There have been reports of cattle death after falling into...quarry," the inspector added.

387.title: Shoaib Malik pens birthday post for Sania Mirza amid divorce rumours
387.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Malik took to Instagram to pen a birthday post for his wife Sania Mirza amid rumours of their divorce. Sharing a picture, Malik wrote, "Happy Birthday to you @mirzasaniar...Wishing you a very healthy & happy life! Enjoy the day to the fullest." The Indian tennis player turned 36 on Tuesday.

388.title: He's fired: Musk to Android engineer who publicly argued with him on Twitter
388.article_body: Elon Musk fired an Android engineer from Twitter after the latter contended his claims of Twitter being "super slow" and argued about it with him on the social media platform. "He's fired," tweeted Musk in the thread involving their communication. Eric Frohnhoefer reportedly received no formal communication about this and was locked out of his computer within five hours.

389.title: Buffett's Berkshire buys $4.1-billion stake in chipmaker TSMC
389.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed a stake worth more than $4.1 billion in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC). Berkshire owns about 60.1 million American depositary shares of the chipmaker. It also disclosed new stakes of $297 million in building materials company Louisiana-Pacific and of $13 million in Jefferies Financial Group.

390.title: SpaceX bought a tiny ad package on Twitter for Starlink: Elon Musk
390.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has revealed that SpaceX Starlink has bought a "tiny" ad package "to test [the] effectiveness of Twitter advertising in Australia and Spain". It did the same for Facebook, Instagram and Google, he added. This comes after reports said that SpaceX had ordered "one of the larger advertising packages available from Twitter".

391.title: Adani Ports forms JV with Gadot Chemical Terminals to buy Israel's Haifa Port
391.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) announced setting up of a joint venture (JV) with Gadot Chemical Terminals in Israel, named Mediterranean International Ports ADGD Ltd. The JV will execute the acquisition of Haifa Port Company, which operates the Haifa Port in Israel. APSEZ holds a 70% stake in the JV, while the remaining will be with Gadot.

392.title: BSF jawan dies after a horse kicks him during championship practice in MP
392.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) jawan died after a horse hit him while he was practicing for an equestrian championship at BSF Academy Tekanpur in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said that during practice, a horse hit the jawan with its leg, causing a fatal head injury. He was pronounced dead after being taken to the hospital.

393.title: Germany nationalises former subsidiary of Russia's Gazprom
393.article_body: Germany has announced the nationalisation of a former subsidiary of Russian state-owned energy giant Gazprom in a bid to ensure energy security amid the war in Ukraine. The new company Securing Energy for Europe GmbH (SEFE), previously called Gazprom Germania, indirectly controls Germany's largest gas storage facility. Berlin had placed the company under its effective control back in April.

394.title: Difficult for MI to release Pollard but need to take tough calls: Harbhajan
394.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh commented on whether IPL franchise Mumbai Indians should retain or release all-rounder Kieron Pollard for the upcoming season. "I think it's going to be very difficult for MI to release Pollard. He has been there for many years. But yes, there are times when you have to take...tough calls," Harbhajan said.

395.title: Maha Speaker denies receiving molestation-accused MLA Awhad's resignation
395.article_body: NCP MLA Jitendra Awhad on Monday said he has tendered his resignation, condemning "false cases" registered against him, and addressed it to Maharashtra Assembly's Speaker. Awhad was booked for outraging the modesty of a female BJP leader. Speaker Rahul Narwekar, however, said Awhad didn't physically submit his resignation letter, which is required as per the rules of the House.

396.title: Farmers defamed, harassed in the name of stubble burning: Tikait
396.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait said farmers are being harassed in the name of stubble burning and commercial use norms of tractor-trolleys. "The government is defaming farmers without realising that we had no other option but to stage the 13-month-long stir," said Tikait. He added that he feared the government would 'imprison' farmers who don't buy seeds from multi-national companies.

397.title: Pet dog helps rescue owner who fainted in forest in Karnataka
397.article_body: A pet dog reportedly helped family members and villagers locate his owner after he got lost deep in a forest in Karnataka's Shivamogga district. When Shekharappa, who went to the forest to collect firewood, didn't return home, a search was launched. His dog joined the search operation hours later and found Shekharappa lying unconscious on the ground in the forest.

398.title: Russia adds 100 Canadians to its no-entry list in retaliatory move
398.article_body: Russia on Monday barred entry to 100 Canadian citizens in response to sanctions against Russians by Canada over the war in Ukraine. The Russian Foreign Ministry said that the Canadians added to its no-entry list included officials, business leaders and people involved with "media and financial structures that are directly involved in the formation of an aggressive anti-Russian course".

399.title: Centre doing nothing to control price rise of essentials: CM Mamata
399.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP-led Centre is doing nothing to check the price rise of essential commodities. "It (Centre) is only interested in using agencies against the Opposition parties. They are...using threats and intimidation tactics," CM Mamata said. She added, "The Centre is taking away all the money through GST but is not giving our (Bengal) dues."

400.title: Stay strong and protect your pride: RSS' Mohan Bhagwat to tribals
400.article_body: RSS leader Mohan Bhagwat, in Chhattisgarh, said tribal pride was India's pride and appealed to people to stand together to protect it for the country. "Some people try to dupe us by taking advantage of our innocence but we have to stay strong," said Bhagwat. Recently, the BJP alleged that religious conversion of tribals is rising in the state.
